World banking and multinational companies are "monopolizing everything in the world" and that's
29.content:
"They're monopolizing everything": African expert on the financial system and how BRICS can change it

World banking and multinational companies are "monopolizing everything in the world" and that's why we need to change the international financial system by establishing a multipolar world, Musawenkosi Mdluli, CEO of World BRICS South Africa, told Sputnik Africa on the sidelines of the forum.

"[...] World banking [...] and [...] multinational companies [...] are monopolizing everything in the world, so we need a new system, even a new currency, a new banking system, a new SWIFT system to change the whole world. Because now everything has been controlled by a few. [...] So the multipolar system will also affect and change the financial system of the world," Mdluli said.

1.title:
🇲🇿 Mozambique's president gets immunity by London court in litigation against Middle Eastern company

The ruling read that President Filipe Nyusi "has immunity from the jurisdiction of the English
1.content:
🇲🇿 Mozambique's president gets immunity by London court in litigation against Middle Eastern company

The ruling read that President Filipe Nyusi "has immunity from the jurisdiction of the English courts whilst he is the head of state of Mozambique."

The case centers on a $3.1 billion lawsuit filed by the Mozambican government against Emirati-Lebanese shipbuilder Privinvest for bribing state officials and Credit Suisse bankers - a case in which Privinvest then tried to implicate the president as a co-conspirator.

In its indictment, Privinvest said that it paid $10 million to the ruling FRELIMO party in 2014 to finance Nyusi's presidential campaign.

Before being elected to his first term in 2015, Nyusi served as Minister of Defense (2008-2014), during which time government contracts were negotiated with Privinvest to supply ships and aircraft, to help the country protect its coastline and exclusive territorial waters.

“Russia is currently in possession of the largest and most diverse nuclear arsenal of any nation,”
1.content:
🇷🇺 Russia possesses largest, most diverse nuclear arsenal in world: US Strategic Command Commander

“Russia is currently in possession of the largest and most diverse nuclear arsenal of any nation,” the commander of US Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM) Gen. Anthony Cotton said.

Beyond its traditional strategic triad, Russia is both increasing and modernizing its nuclear options, Cotton said.

“These include nuclear-capable hypersonic systems such as the Tsirkon land attack cruise missile and the Kinzhal air-launched ballistic missile, the last of which Russia has employed frequently against Ukraine in a conventional role,” he noted.

In her post, Ms. Simonyan demanded explanations from the German ambassador, the German foreign minister and Scholz himself by this afternoon.

1.title: ❗️A Bundeswehr Air Force inspector who took part in the discussion of the strike on the Crimean Bridge allowed the transfer of 100 Taurus missiles to Kiev in two
content-segmented: ❗️A Bundeswehr Air Force inspector who took part in the discussion of the strike on the Crimean Bridge allowed the transfer of 100 Taurus missiles to Kiev in two batches.

▪️The German military discussed the possibility of attacking with these missiles using a Dassault Rafale fighter, as follows from the transcript published by Margarita Simonyan, editor-in-chief of RT and Rossiya Segodnya, Sputnik's parent media group;
▪️The representative of the Bundeswehr said that Taurus missiles, when delivered to Ukraine, will be ready for use in eight months;

▪️One of the participants in the conversation doubted whether the strike on the bridge would be effective, and asked the question of how many missiles it would take: “It may not require 10 or even 20 missiles";
▪️The issue of transferring Taurus missiles to Kiev has been discussed in Germany lately.
The Bundestag recently adopted a draft resolution on the supply of long-range weapons, but without specifying the type;
▪️At the same time, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has repeatedly stated that he is against such supplies.
The German military, in a document published by Simonyan, touches on this topic - one of those present says that "no one knows why the chancellor is blocking these supplies."

1.title:
🇿🇲 Zambia declares state of emergency due to prolonged drought

"With heavy hearts, we've declared a national disaster & emergency as our country faces severe drought, caused by El Nino weather
1.content:
🇿🇲 Zambia declares state of emergency due to prolonged drought

"With heavy hearts, we've declared a national disaster & emergency as our country faces severe drought, caused by El Nino weather phenomenon, influenced by climate change,"  Zambian President Hakainde Hichilema said on X.

He added that the disaster has affected both "Zambia's food and energy security", which are "key priorities". 

The prolonged drought has already affected 84 out of 116 districts in seven provinces of Zambia, destroying one million hectares of maize and affecting one million farming households, according to the president.

African nations are among the most vulnerable to the effects of climate challenges, despite producing only a fraction of global greenhouse gas emissions.

1.title:
🇷🇺 🌍 Africa is becoming one of the priority areas for Russia's foreign policy course, the foreign ministry says

"Now we see that after the second [Russia-Africa] summit, which our president
1.content:
🇷🇺 🌍 Africa is becoming one of the priority areas for Russia's foreign policy course, the foreign ministry says

"Now we see that after the second [Russia-Africa] summit, which our president [Vladimir Putin] yesterday called a breakthrough in his address to the Federal Assembly, we have been able to move on to systematic work on building long-term strategic cooperation with the African continent," Oleg Ozerov, head of the secretariat of the Russia-Africa Partnership Forum, told reporters.

Ozerov added that Russia's cooperation with African countries is aimed at creating new forms of interaction and developing a constructive agenda in various areas, stressing that it is "not cooperation against anyone".

"Despite all the problems, difficulties and conflicts, there is a consistent development of African countries, and we need to be part of this process," the diplomat concluded.

1.title:
🇪🇬 Egypt tops the list of most influential countries in Africa in terms of soft power

In the world ranking, Egypt took the 39th place, according to the annual report Global Soft Power Index 2024 by
content-segmented: 🇪🇬 Egypt tops the list of most influential countries in Africa in terms of soft power
In the world ranking, Egypt took the 39th place, according to the annual report Global Soft Power Index 2024 by the British consulting company Brand Finance.
Egypt is followed on the continent by the following countries:
🔹 South Africa (43rd in the world);
🔹 Morocco (50th);
🔹 Algeria (73rd);
🔹 Tunisia (77th);
🔹 Nigeria (79th);
🔹 Ghana (85th);
🔹 Tanzania (93rd);
🔹 Senegal (94th);
🔹 Kenya (95th).

Soft power is defined in the report as a country's ability to influence the sympathies and behavior of other people and states in the international arena through its example and its values, rather than coercion.

1.content:

Jean-Vincent Brisset responded to Sputnik Africa about the leak of a conversation among German officers discussing potential strikes on the Crimean Bridge. 

"The last time French leaders attempted to conquer Russia was with Napoleon, and it ended very poorly. As for the German leaders, they did, indeed do several things during World War II, but it also turned out quite badly for the Germans," the general argued.

💬 "The lesson is that seeking to conquer Moscow has, so far, never been successful," he added.

1.title:
🇷🇺 🇳🇬 Russia offers Nigeria cooperation in exploration of oil and gas fields

"Russian companies are ready to offer their services in the search and exploration of hydrocarbon deposits, marine
1.content:
🇷🇺 🇳🇬 Russia offers Nigeria cooperation in exploration of oil and gas fields

"Russian companies are ready to offer their services in the search and exploration of hydrocarbon deposits, marine seismic exploration in Nigeria," Russia's Energy Minister Nikolay Shulginov said at a meeting with the Minister of State for Petroleum Resources (Gas) of Nigeria, Ekperikpe Ekpo.

The meeting took place within the framework of the Gas Exporting Countries Forum in Algeria.

The parties also discussed cooperation on the creation of a network of gas filling stations and expressed their interest in developing the energy dialogue in all areas, including geological work. They also discussed cooperation in the format of the GECF and OPEC+.

1.title:
🌎 💵 De-dollarization offers countries greater autonomy over their monetary policies, reducing dependence on West, says expert

"If we are able to really move away from that dominance of the dollar,
1.content:
🌎 💵 De-dollarization offers countries greater autonomy over their monetary policies, reducing dependence on West, says expert

"If we are able to really move away from that dominance of the dollar, countries such as Tanzania and Kenya could actually trade using their shilling, which could also really be beneficial for both countries, as opposed to, first of all, changing their currencies to the dollar so that they can be able to really trade," Dr. Nicodemus Minde, a researcher at the Institute for Security Studies in Nairobi, told Sputnik Africa.

Vladimir Putin's criticism of Western neo-colonial practices struck a chord with Dr. Minde, reflecting a broader sentiment in Africa and the global South against remnants of colonialism.

He highlighted how countries in the Sahel region, formerly under colonial rule, are reevaluating their relationships with former colonial powers like France.

1.content:

He also noted that the US Congress has still not approved the additional 60 billion that the country's President Joe Biden has requested.

"So I think we are getting closer and closer to the moment when Biden is going to let go of Zelensky and tell the Europeans, 'Get on with this ball,'" he continued.

Corves stressed that Biden "will even accuse the Europeans of being responsible for this aggression, as he did in Afghanistan."

"It is the habit of the United States to let go of its allies without a second thought," he concluded.

1.title:
🇿🇦🇮🇱🇵🇸 Pretoria сondemns Israel for "targeted killing of Palestinian civilians"

"South Africa condemns the massacre of 112 Palestinians and the injury of hundreds more as they sought life-saving
1.content:
🇿🇦🇮🇱🇵🇸 Pretoria сondemns Israel for "targeted killing of Palestinian civilians"

"South Africa condemns the massacre of 112 Palestinians and the injury of hundreds more as they sought life-saving aid. The Israeli forces fired on hundreds of Palestinian civilians already vulnerable due to the onslaught on Palestinians over the last four months," a statement by the SA Foreign Ministry reads.

The ministry emphasized that the attack occurred days after Israel had submitted its report to the UN International Court of Justice regarding its compliance with international norms during its military operation in the Gaza Strip.

"An immediate and unconditional call for a ceasefire is now a moral and life-saving necessity," the statement reads.

Israeli forces' attack on Palestinians awaiting humanitarian aid in Gaza's An-Nablusi region resulted in 112 deaths and 760 injured on February 29, according to the Palestinian enclave's health ministry.

1.content:
✍️15 resolutions adopted at UN Climate Summit in Nairobi 

Moreover, two decisions, and a ministerial declaration were approved, according to the Assembly President and Moroccan Minister of Energy and Sustainable Development Leila Benali. 

Key areas covered by the resolutions include water management, improvement of national air quality monitoring systems, land conservation, and sustainable land management practices.

She added that the Declaration recognizes the dire urgency of addressing the environmental crisis, endorses key principles and results from past declarations, and lays out 10 actions which they environmental ministers pledged to implement.

2.title:
🇷🇺🌍🇸🇸 Russia supports the African Union's steps to stabilize South Sudan

“We support international steps to stabilize the situation in the country, strengthen peace and security, including the
2.content:
🇷🇺🌍🇸🇸 Russia supports the African Union's steps to stabilize South Sudan

“We support international steps to stabilize the situation in the country, strengthen peace and security, including the mediation efforts of the African Union,” said Ilya Barmin, a representative of the Russian delegation, at the United Nations Human Rights Council meeting.

The diplomat noted that Russia welcomes the successes of the South Sudanese leadership in creating state governments, forming chambers of a transitional parliament, working on a draft constitution, and establishing the National Human Rights Council.

However, Moscow “categorically rejects the use of international platforms, including the Human Rights Council, to exert political pressure” on South Sudan, Barmin added.

The fund is the central part of the project 'Catalyzing Investments into Renewable Energy
2.content:
🇿🇼 Zimbabwe to launch a Renewable Energy Fund with initial investment of $45 million, state media reports

The fund is the central part of the project 'Catalyzing Investments into Renewable Energy for the Acceleration of the Attainment of the SDGs in Zimbabwe,' which was launched by the country's Energy and Power Development Ministry in partnership with UNESCO, UNDP, UNWOMEN, UNCDF.

International financial services group Old Mutual will manage the fund.

"It is anticipated that more institutional investors will come in and commit to the Fund to enable creation of positive futures in the renewable energy space. We will continue to support government programmes through this initiative," Old Mutual Сhief Finance Officer Tendai Mudekunye.

2.title:
🌍📈 Africa surpasses expectations to become the world's second-fastest growing region

Africa's economies continue to grow faster than the global average of 3% despite climate change, geopolitical
2.content:
🌍📈 Africa surpasses expectations to become the world's second-fastest growing region

Africa's economies continue to grow faster than the global average of 3% despite climate change, geopolitical tensions, rising inflation, food insecurity, and rising debt, according to Akinwumi Adesina, president of the African Development Bank Group (AfDB).

"It is forecasted that Africa will account for 11 out of the 20 fastest-growing economies in the world in 2024. Fifteen African countries have posted output expansions of more than 5%," Adesina said.

Last month, the AfDB projected that Africa will be the second-fastest expanding region globally, following Asia, with real GDP growth to average 3.8% in 2024 and 4.2% in 2025, above the expected global rates of 2.9% and 3.2%, respectively.

Subscribe @sputnik_africa

Africa's economies continue to grow faster than the global average of 3% despite climate change, geopolitical tensions, rising inflation, food insecurity, and rising debt, according to Akinwumi Adesina, president of the African Development Bank Group (AfDB).
"It is forecasted that Africa will account for 11 out of the 20 fastest-growing economies in the world in 2024.
Fifteen African countries have posted output expansions of more than 5%," Adesina said.

Last month, the AfDB projected that Africa will be the second-fastest expanding region globally, following Asia, with real GDP growth to average 3.8% in 2024 and 4.2% in 2025, above the expected global rates of 2.9% and 3.2%, respectively.

2.title:
🇳🇪🇧🇯 The Niger-Benin pipeline is officially put into service, the Beninese media report

🛢 Production immediately started in Niger’s oilfield Agadem and its first loading is planned for May 2024,
2.content:
🇳🇪🇧🇯 The Niger-Benin pipeline is officially put into service, the Beninese media report

🛢 Production immediately started in Niger’s oilfield Agadem and its first loading is planned for May 2024, reports say. The pipeline will make it possible to export crude oil from Niger to international markets via the Benin oil terminal.

According to media sources, the Beninese side will welcome a delegation of senior Nigerien customs officials between March 3 and 8.

The pipeline is nearly 2,000 km long, of which 675 km pass over Beninese soil. Investments in the project amount to $6 billion. The pipeline is expected to transport 200,000 barrels of oil per day in 2026.

The starting point of the pipeline is the pumping station, located in the city of Djiffa in Niger. It terminates in a single-point mooring system at sea at Sèmè-Kraké, southeastern Benin.

2.content:

The increase in the production of weapons by Berlin could finally "lead to a new war in Europe, because many Germans still secretly adhere to Nazism and dream of conquering the world," according to Emad Abshenas.

3.title:
🇸🇳 Senegalese take to the streets of the capital, Dakar, to demand that presidential elections be held before April 2

The political crisis in the country started in early February when Senegal's
3.content:
🇸🇳 Senegalese take to the streets of the capital, Dakar, to demand that presidential elections be held before April 2

The political crisis in the country started in early February when Senegal's incumbent President, Macky Sall, revoked a decree convening an electoral council on February 25, meaning that presidential elections will not be held on that date.

The decree was overturned by the country's Constitutional Council and a national dialogue was organized in an attempt to calm the unrest. The national dialogue panel proposed that the election be held on June 2 and that Sall's term, which expires on April 2, be extended until a successor is elected.

Images taken from social media

3.title:
🇲🇱 ECOWAS has done nothing to help the Sahel fight terrorism, says Mali's Foreign Minister, Abdoulaye Diop

Diop explained the reasons for his country's withdrawal from the organization during
3.content:
🇲🇱 ECOWAS has done nothing to help the Sahel fight terrorism, says Mali's Foreign Minister, Abdoulaye Diop

Diop explained the reasons for his country's withdrawal from the organization during discussions at the 3rd Antalya Diplomacy Forum in Turkey. 

What's more, some partners who wanted to work with the Sahel countries were at the root of the spread of terrorism and financed it, said the head of Mali's diplomacy.

Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso will now focus on strengthening their security within the framework of the Sahel Alliance, said Mr. Diop. 

These three countries have announced their withdrawal in January 2024. Since 2016, the number of victims of terrorism in these three states has quintupled. Terrorist attacks have led to an increase in the number of displaced persons and have particularly exacerbated religious differences.

3.title:
🇷🇺 🇪🇹 Russia and Ethiopia should start talks on using national currencies in trade, says Ethiopian ambassador

"I don't see any problem in using national currencies in trade between Russia and
3.content:
🇷🇺 🇪🇹 Russia and Ethiopia should start talks on using national currencies in trade, says Ethiopian ambassador

"I don't see any problem in using national currencies in trade between Russia and Ethiopia. I hope that in the future this will be the subject of negotiations between our countries. I see only advantages in it. If Ethiopia wants to buy something from Russia, we can safely use the Ethiopian birr," said Ambassador Cham Ugala Uriat.

The issue of financial transfers is now a big problem, as the diplomat pointed out.

"We know that Russia and China, India, Saudi Arabia have already started using national currencies in mutual trade. I think that using national currencies is a good format for cooperation. Now that we are part of BRICS, this will be one of the issues that the countries will discuss," he added.

3.title: 🇳🇬 Nigerian actor John Okafor, also known as
3.content:
🇳🇬 Nigerian actor John Okafor, also known as Mr. Ibu, has passed away at the age of 62

Okafor, who had been struggling with health problems since October 2023, reportedly died of cardiac arrest on Saturday at the Evercare Hospital in the Nigerian city of Lekki. He had been transferred to the intensive care unit just a few days earlier. News of his death was confirmed by Emeka Rollas, President of the Actors Guild of Nigeria.

Okafor starred in more than 200 Nollywood films, including those in the Mr. Ibu series, for example, Mr. Ibu (2004), Mr. Ibu 2 (2005), Mr. Ibu and His Son, Coffin Producers, Husband Suppliers and others.

3.title:
🇺🇸 Billionaire Elon Musk questions NATO's continued existence after the end of the Cold War

Musk argued that NATO should have been disbanded when the Warsaw Treaty Organization, which included the
3.content:
🇺🇸 Billionaire Elon Musk questions NATO's continued existence after the end of the Cold War

Musk argued that NATO should have been disbanded when the Warsaw Treaty Organization, which included the USSR, collapsed in 1991.

The American entrepreneur was responding to a post on social network X by billionaire David Sachs, who wrote of NATO's "existential crisis" after the collapse of the USSR. Instead of disbanding, the North Atlantic Alliance has a new mission — expansion — Sachs wrote.

He added that bureaucracies often "live their own lives" and end up creating the very problems they are supposed to solve. NATO, which was ostensibly meant to "prevent war," has expanded to Russia's borders and "tried to encircle it, provoking war."

The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) was created on April 4, 1949, during the period of growing international tensions during the Cold War.

3.title:
BRICS entry holds promise for Egypt's economic advancement 

Egyptian analyst Nourhan Elsheikh of the Valdai Discussion Club emphasizes the significance of Egypt joining BRICS, foreseeing positive
3.content:
BRICS entry holds promise for Egypt's economic advancement 

Egyptian analyst Nourhan Elsheikh of the Valdai Discussion Club emphasizes the significance of Egypt joining BRICS, foreseeing positive impacts on various sectors, including investments, trade, and tourism. 

She believes Egypt's strategic location and position will contribute to shaping a fairer economic order within BRICS and beyond.  

“I think we expect a lot from BRICS and within BRICS we can do also and we can introduce also a lot. Egypt is an African-Arab-Mediterranean country with a very strategic position and location,” she said on the sidelines of the World Youth Festival in Sirius, Russia. 

While acknowledging that the de-dollarization of the Global South will require time, she underscores the importance of initiating change for a more equitable global financial system.

4.title:
🇿🇼 Livestock branding to be compulsory from June in Zimbabwe

The Veterinary Services Department will require all animals to be branded for
4.content:
🇿🇼 Livestock branding to be compulsory from June in Zimbabwe

The Veterinary Services Department will require all animals to be branded for approval. The necessity for livestock owners to update stock records is vital for the nation's Vision 2030 and rural communities, provincial Vet supervisor Simon Heya stressed. 

🐮 Although cattle theft is declining, even a single loss has a significant impact, stated Chief Superintendent Gladman Chiparaushe, underscoring the role of branding in preventing anonymous sales. Community involvement is crucial to these efforts, with local committees tackling the problem from the ground up.

Parliament Member Maxmore Njanji called for better cooperation between farmers and police, mandatory cattle herder screening, and noted the significance of livestock for food stability and climate resilience, in line with National Development Strategy 1.

4.title: 🇫🇷 France has provided
4.content:
🇫🇷 France has provided 3.8 billion euros in aid to Ukraine for military purposes since February 2022, the EU country's Ministry of Armed Forces says 

A report published by the ministry on March 3 states that military equipment worth 2.615 billion euros has been sent to Ukraine, which includes:

⚫️30 Caesar artillery systems,
⚫️1,002 AT4 anti-tank weapons,
⚫️ 38 AMX10 RC reconnaissance vehicles,
⚫️250 VABs, both combat and medical variants,
⚫️ 30,000 artillery shells of 155 mm caliber, and
⚫️160 unmanned aerial reconnaissance systems.

Details on the quantities of SCALP cruise missiles, Crotale, Mistral and Aster surface-to-air missiles, and Milan anti-tank systems remain undisclosed.

Additionally, France has allocated 1.2 billion euros to the European Peace Facility (EFF) and has trained 10,000 Ukrainian troops on French and Polish territories.

4.content:
🇷🇺 Moscow shines bright at the World Youth Festival #WYF2024 with local goods

Moscow’s entrepreneurs united under the umbrella brand "Made in Moscow" are taking part in the World Youth Festival at the Sirius Federal Territory in Sochi, which gathered thousands of young participants from all over the world.

A stand with goods produced in Moscow by locals, including T-shirts, backpacks, shoes, cosmetics among other things, appeared to draw the attention of the festival guests. Participants of the Festival from more than 50 countries, including the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Zimbabwe, China, Syria, the UAE, and others, visited the "Made in Moscow" stand on the first day of its opening.

According to one of the participants from Zimbabwe, the brand, which is a part of the Moscow government's program aimed at supporting small and medium enterprises, represents a great example for others of how the state should support its businesses.

4.title:
🇿🇦 🎵 Miriam Makeba's 92nd birth anniversary: Mama Africa's resilient voice bridging cultures

On the 92nd birthday of the late South African singer Miriam Makeba, affectionately known as Mama Africa,
4.content:
🇿🇦 🎵 Miriam Makeba's 92nd birth anniversary: Mama Africa's resilient voice bridging cultures

On the 92nd birthday of the late South African singer Miriam Makeba, affectionately known as Mama Africa, the world remembers her as more than an icon - she was a fierce advocate for equality, a bridge between cultures, and the embodiment of resilience.

In the 1950s, she entered the professional stage, lending her voice to various groups. In 1959, however, Makeba's life took a pivotal turn when she starred in the anti-apartheid film "Come Back, Africa".

She was one of the first African musicians to receive international recognition. The Grammy Award-winning artist brought African music to Western audiences and popularized the genres of world music and Afropop.

There is a longstanding relationship between Russia and African countries, Zambia in
4.content:
🇷🇺 🇿🇲 Africa-Russia partnerships should focus on education and technology: Head of Zambian graduates alumni

There is a longstanding relationship between Russia and African countries, Zambia in particular, dating back to pre-independence times. Meanwhile, there is a potential for enhanced cooperation, Patricia Kalinga, President of the Zambian-Russian Graduates Alumni Association (ZAMRUS), told Sputnik Africa on the sidelines of the World Youth Festival.

According to her, by leveraging the expertise gained through their education in Russia, African graduates are not only contributing to the growth of their nations but also fostering deeper ties between Africa and Russia in the business and professional spheres, she explained.

"We need to learn more from Russia in terms of technology," she assumed. "If we tap some of the magic that they are doing here in Russia, I think we can do better in Africa."

4.content:
🇷🇺Russia's newest T-14 Armata tank is in service with the Russian army, head of Rostec confirms 

The Armata is "far superior to existing tanks," Director General of the Rostec State Corporation Sergey Chemezov told Sputnik.

This state-of-the-art main battle tank is intended to succeed the T-72 and T-90 tanks, which are the backbone of Russia's armored forces.

With a mass of 55 tons, this armored vehicle boasts a main gun capable of firing 125mm shells. Its weaponry also comprises a 7.62mm coaxial machine gun to fight against infantry forces and a 12.7mm remotely operated anti-aircraft machine gun with a range of up to 1.5 kilometers for countering air threats.

5.content:
🇵🇸 UNRWA Commissioner-General Lazzarini says 50% decline in Gaza aid following ICJ ruling

Aid to Gaza has halved since January despite the International Court of Justice's orders, UNRWA Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini said during a press briefing on Monday.

In January, the International Court of Justice (ICJ) ruled on provisional measures in South Africa's case against Israel over alleged genocide in the Gaza Strip. 

The court ordered Israel to take urgent measures to prevent acts of genocide and ensure the flow of humanitarian aid to the enclave. At the same time, the ICJ did not order an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

In January, the International Court of Justice (ICJ) ruled on provisional measures in South Africa's case against Israel over alleged genocide in the Gaza Strip.
The court ordered Israel to take urgent measures to prevent acts of genocide and ensure the flow of humanitarian aid to the enclave.
At the same time, the ICJ did not order an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

5.content:
🇸🇩 🇷🇺 Sudan's new parliament to consider deal with Russia on navy base, Foreign Minister says

Sudan's new parliament will consider the agreement with Russia on the creation of a nave base in the country after the elections, Sudanese Foreign Minister Ali Al-Sadiq Ali told Sputnik.

In February, Russian Ambassador to Sudan Andrey Chernovol told Sputnik that the country has not yet been able to complete the procedure for ratifying the agreement on the establishment of a Russian navy base in Port Sudan on the Red Sea.

"We have no fundamental objections to the agreements reached under the previous government. This is an obligation of the state," Ali said on the sidelines of the Diplomatic Forum in Antalya.

5.title:
🇮🇷 Iran's proposal to set up SWIFT analogue added to BRICS agenda, Central Bank official states

The BRICS leadership will also consider creation of an organization to fight money laundering and
5.content:
🇮🇷 Iran's proposal to set up SWIFT analogue added to BRICS agenda, Central Bank official states

The BRICS leadership will also consider creation of an organization to fight money laundering and terrorist financing that would be similar to the intergovernmental Financial Action Task Force (FATF), Deputy Head of Iranian Central Bank Mohsen Karimi said on Monday.

The BRICS member states, as the largest emerging economies, need to establish a settlement mechanism to achieve a unified financial system, in which "the Iranian side can play a huge role," Karimi was quoted as saying by the IRNA news agency.

Iran, with its financial system hit hard by Western sanctions and cut off from the SWIFT payment system in March 2012, and an array of Russian banks were also disconnected in February 2022. Since then, the two countries have been making efforts to find alternatives or create.

Mediators from Qatar and Egypt told Israeli negotiators during talks in Doha last week that the return of
5.content:
🇵🇸Hamas ready to reduce number of Palestinians released as part of hostage deal, reports say

Mediators from Qatar and Egypt told Israeli negotiators during talks in Doha last week that the return of Palestinians to northern Gaza is a top priority for Hamas, the report said, adding that the Israeli delegation was surprised at how important it was to Hamas.

However, Israel sees such a move by Hamas as politically motivated, since it could strengthen the movement's position as a ruling body in the enclave, as well as deprive Israel of a point of leverage in the next phase of negotiations, the report read.

On Sunday, the news portal reported that the framework of a proposed deal for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip included an exchange of some 400 Palestinian prisoners held in Israel for 40 Israeli hostages. The draft deal may include a prisoner swap, a six-week hostilities pause, and the return of Palestinians to northern Gaza.

5.title: 🌍 Africa to lack
5.content:
🌍 Africa to lack $2.5 trillion in climate needs by 2030, UN warns

As Africa receives only 2% of global investment in the sector and needs $2.8 trillion by 2030, the consequences of underfunding clean energy can be worse, chief economist of the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa, Hanan Morsy,  told a conference in Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe.

"We end up in a vicious circle with investment shortfalls increasing exposure risk and worsening impact, further eroding fiscal space and raising finance costs," Morsy explained.

Despite low emissions compared to other continents, climate change is costing African countries 5% of their gross domestic product each year, she added.

The Algerian government has committed to aiding Mozambique against Islamist militants in the northern province of Cabo
5.content:
🇩🇿 🇲🇿 Algeria pledges to help Mozambique fight terrorism, President Nyusi says

The Algerian government has committed to aiding Mozambique against Islamist militants in the northern province of Cabo Delgado, said Mozambican President Filipe Nyusi, quoted by Mozambique's news agency.

The leader noted that during his meeting with Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune, the delegations discussed forms of equipment and information exchange, adding that a document will be finalized to guide defense and security cooperation.

Regarding the fight against crime, Nyusi said that Algeria would help train police to fight kidnapping gangs in major cities as well as finance the construction of a national pantheon in honor of the heroes of Mozambique's struggle for independence, to be built in the capital, Maputo.

5.title:
🇬🇧🇷🇼 UK House of Lords 'defeats' PM Sunak by sending scheme to deport migrants to Rwanda for review

The House of Lords, the upper house of the British Parliament, has voted to introduce stricter
5.content:
🇬🇧🇷🇼 UK House of Lords 'defeats' PM Sunak by sending scheme to deport migrants to Rwanda for review

The House of Lords, the upper house of the British Parliament, has voted to introduce stricter safeguards into a scheme devised by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to send asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda.

Specifically, the House voted in favor of an amendment stating that the legislation must be in full compliance with international and domestic law, as well as an amendment requiring proof that Rwanda is safe for refugees before planes can leave the country.

The Lords also backed an amendment that would mean flights could not begin until a treaty providing legal safeguards in Rwanda's asylum system is fully implemented.

British media characterized the vote as "the first defeats on Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's government as it tries to pass controversial legislation."

content-segmented: 🇬🇧🇷🇼 UK House of Lords 'defeats' PM Sunak by sending scheme to deport migrants to Rwanda for review

The House of Lords, the upper house of the British Parliament, has voted to introduce stricter safeguards into a scheme devised by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to send asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda.

Specifically, the House voted in favor of an amendment stating that the legislation must be in full compliance with international and domestic law, as well as an amendment requiring proof that Rwanda is safe for refugees before planes can leave the country.
The Lords also backed an amendment that would mean flights could not begin until a treaty providing legal safeguards in Rwanda's asylum system is fully implemented.
British media characterized the vote as "the first defeats on Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's government as it tries to pass controversial legislation."

5.content:
🇬🇭Ghana can potentially lose $3.8 billion due to anti-LGBT* bill, reports reveal

Ghana's finance ministry warned that the nation could face a potential loss in funding from international banks over the next five to six years if President Nana Akufo-Addo enacts an anti-LGBT bill, as reported by the media on Monday.

The finance ministry's statement advised the country to engage with conservative nations such as Arab countries and China to raise more funds.

Legislation banning LGBT activities and criminalizing their promotion, advocacy and funding in the West African nation was unanimously approved by parliament last Wednesday after being introduced three years ago.

5.title:

The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has launched the Insurance and Risk Financing Facility (IRFF)
5.content:
🇺🇳🇪🇹 UN launches insurance and risk financing facility in Ethiopia to help manage shocks

The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has launched the Insurance and Risk Financing Facility (IRFF) in Ethiopia to help the country build the capacity of communities and businesses to cope with shocks, UNDP said in a statement.

"The facility will help develop accessible, affordable and innovative insurance products for farmers and businesses to help them bounce back stronger from socio-political as well as climatic shocks," the UN said.

Speaking at the launch ceremony, UNDP Resident Representative Samuel Doe said the launch of the IRFF in Ethiopia is critical to strengthening the insurance sector and building the resilience of the population.

5.title:
🇸🇴 Somalia officially becomes full member of East African Community

Somalia became the Eighth Partner State of the East African Community by submitting its instrument of ratification of the Treaty
5.content:
🇸🇴 Somalia officially becomes full member of East African Community

Somalia became the Eighth Partner State of the East African Community by submitting its instrument of ratification of the Treaty of Accession with the EAC Secretary General during a ceremony in Arusha, Tanzania on Monday, the EAC stated.

Somalia's Minister of Commerce and Industry, Jibril Abdirashid Haji Abdi, submitted the nation's instrument of ratification to the EAC Secretary General, Peter Mathuki, finalizing the admission process in accordance with the EAC Admission Procedure of New Members.

"Today’s occasion of Somalia depositing the instruments of the ratification with the Secretary-General, will enable Somalia to kick off the process of joining EAC’s areas of cooperation," said Mathuki, as cited by the media.

5.title:
🇰🇪 Two planes collide in Kenya, killing two people

A trainer and a passenger plane collided over a national park in Kenya's capital, Nairobi, causing the smaller plane to crash, police said, adding
5.content:
🇰🇪 Two planes collide in Kenya, killing two people

A trainer and a passenger plane collided over a national park in Kenya's capital, Nairobi, causing the smaller plane to crash, police said, adding that a flight student and the trainer died.

The larger Dash 8 aircraft operated by Safarilink Aviation carried 44 people, including five crew members, all of whom escaped injury.

It was en route to the coastal resort of Diani when the crew reported a loud bang shortly after takeoff from Wilson Airport and decided to turn back, the airline said.

5.title:
🇲🇦🏜 How and when unique moving Moroccan star dune was formed?

A team of experts has determined the age of a Moroccan star dune called Lala Lallia and unearthed information regarding its development
5.content:
🇲🇦🏜 How and when unique moving Moroccan star dune was formed?

A team of experts has determined the age of a Moroccan star dune called Lala Lallia and unearthed information regarding its development and movement across the desert, according to the new study.

The scientists were shocked to learn that the top of the dune had only formed in the previous 1,000 years or so, even though they found that the dune's base was 13,000 years old.

“It turned out to be surprisingly young,” Prof Geoff Duller, the co-author of the research paper, told the Western media.

The expert explained that the dune was created by the convergence of winds blowing from the southwest and northeast, causing sand to accumulate. The dune is slowly moving westward at a pace of roughly 50 centimeters per year due to a third wind that blows steadily from the east.

6.title:
🇷🇺 ⚛️ IAEA's Grossi to meet with Russian officials in Sochi for high-level talks on nuclear safety 

International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director-General Mariano Grossi will meet with officials
6.content:
🇷🇺 ⚛️ IAEA's Grossi to meet with Russian officials in Sochi for high-level talks on nuclear safety 

International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director-General Mariano Grossi will meet with officials from several Russian agencies in Sochi on Wednesday to discuss the situation at the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant, which he described this week as "precarious."

Located on the left bank of the Dnipro River, the Zaporozhye power plant is the largest nuclear facility in Europe.

It came under Russian control in early 2022 and has since been repeatedly shelled, raising safety concerns. IAEA experts have been monitoring the situation on site since the fall of 2022.

6.content:

Szijjarto noted that it is reassuring to him to see a vast majority of the European leaders, including NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg, oppose the prospects of sending Western troops to Ukraine in light of Macron's statement.

A deployment of Western troops to Ukraine would increase the chances of igniting a third world war, he added.

"Boeing and Ethiopian Airlines announced today an agreement for the East African airline to purchase
6.content:
🇪🇹 Ethiopian Airlines confirms deal to buy eight 777-9 aircraft to expand fleet, Boeing says

"Boeing and Ethiopian Airlines announced today an agreement for the East African airline to purchase eight 777-9 passenger airplanes and the potential for up to 12 additional jets," Boeing company announced in a press release on Tuesday.

✈️The sale follows Ethiopian Airlines' previous purchase of 11 Boeing 787 Dreamliners and 20 737 MAX aircraft in 2023 to modernize and grow its fleet, the release said.

"The 777-9 will support Ethiopian Airlines' plans to grow and renew its fleet in size, range and passenger and cargo capacity to reach high-demand markets in Africa, Asia, Europe and North America," the release added.

6.title:

African countries should shift away from the World Bank and the IMF,
6.content:
🌍 "BRICS has a better option for us," African participant at the World Youth Festival says

African countries should shift away from the World Bank and the IMF, Dr. John Aggrey, the head of the Ghanaian delegation to the World Youth Festival told Sputnik Africa, stressing the alternative in the form of the BRICS platform for trade on the continent and settlement in national currencies.

"They give you the money but at the same time you are still, there's still nothing in your country. I believe BRICS and the new BRICS currency and what is going on has the better option to trade, and also I'm thinking the free trade in Africa has a better position to work with BRICS countries for trading, especially in their national currency," he said.

#WYF2024

6.title:
🇺🇸 🇨🇩 US court rules in favor of American tech giants in DR Congo child labor case

The US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia sided with five US major technology companies accused of
6.content:
🇺🇸 🇨🇩 US court rules in favor of American tech giants in DR Congo child labor case

The US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia sided with five US major technology companies accused of profiting from child labor in cobalt mining operations in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

The plaintiffs complained that the US companies were complicit in the exploitation of child labor by purchasing cobalt, a key component of lithium-ion batteries used extensively in electronics.

💻The complaint was filed by the former child miners and their representatives against Google's parent company Alphabet, Apple, Dell Technologies, Microsoft, and Tesla for their alleged involvement in child labor in the Central African country.

Gennady Bendersky, General Director of the Almaz Research and Production
6.content:
🇷🇺 Russian Defense Minister inspects fulfillment of state defense order by enterprises of Almaz-Antey Corporation 

Gennady Bendersky, General Director of the Almaz Research and Production Corporation, informed Sergey Shoigu that the company has developed new means to combat unmanned aerial vehicles, which are currently being tested at the factory. 

The Russian Defense Minister was presented with a mobile control station for engaging air targets and the latest models of anti-battery radar stations, the production of which was successfully launched in 2023.

🪖 As a result of the visit, a working meeting was held, at where it was decided to immediately deploy the means of attack with the produced anti-battery radar systems. This applies not only to firepower in general, but also to unmanned aerial vehicles. One of the main tasks of these systems is to "react immediately to enemy fire," Sergey Shoigu noted.

6.title:
🇷🇺Putin backs initiative to create grain exchange within BRICS

"All these exchange indices are formed either in the United States or in Europe, in
6.content:
🇷🇺Putin backs initiative to create grain exchange within BRICS

"All these exchange indices are formed either in the United States or in Europe, in Paris. I don't know, how much grain do the French produce? I think less than we do," the Russian leader said at a meeting with representatives of the agro-industrial sector on Tuesday.

Traditionally, the stock exchange index is set there, which is unfair because it influences prices, Putin added, noting that since there are countries in BRICS that produce and buy grain, they may be interested in creating such an exchange.

Russia's share in the world grain market is approaching 25%, and every fourth tonne of grain is of Russian origin, Eduard Zernin, the head of the Russian Union of Grain Exporters, said at the meeting.

6.title:
🇷🇼 🇨🇩 Rwanda challenges AU's endorsement of SADC troops deployment in Eastern DR Congo

Rwandan Foreign Minister Vincent Biruta warned the African Union against backing SADC troop deployment in
6.content:
🇷🇼 🇨🇩 Rwanda challenges AU's endorsement of SADC troops deployment in Eastern DR Congo

Rwandan Foreign Minister Vincent Biruta warned the African Union against backing SADC troop deployment in eastern DR Congo, arguing it could worsen the conflict.

In a letter to AU Commission Chair Moussa Faki Mahamat, Biruta expressed concern over a meeting to discuss SADC Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (SAMIDRC's) deployment, cautioning that AU endorsement could further entrench Kinshasa's aggression and hinder a peaceful resolution of the long-standing crisis.

He accused the regional force of collaborating with the Congolese army and other coalition armed groups, including the Rwandan rebels of the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda, an ethnic militia directly linked to the 1994 genocide against Tutsis in Rwanda.

6.content:

6.title:
🇺🇬 Time to chicken out? Only 10% of the poultry in Uganda is reportedly antibiotics-free

"90 percent of chicken consumed by the public contains antibiotics which are given to the chicken to grow
6.content:
🇺🇬 Time to chicken out? Only 10% of the poultry in Uganda is reportedly antibiotics-free

"90 percent of chicken consumed by the public contains antibiotics which are given to the chicken to grow fast. Most Ugandans in town are eating white chicken which is three weeks old. Such chicken is fed on antibiotics," the World Animal Protection's wildlife campaign manager Edith Kabesiime said, as cited by the media.

On Tuesday, Kabesiime reportedly said that overconsumption of white chicken treated with antibiotics can lead to health risks such as higher levels of cholesterol, cancer, and other serious diseases in humans.

Kabesiime also criticized the inadequate enforcement of laws and the delay of relevant bills in parliament, stating that this situation leaves Ugandan chicken consumers vulnerable, the report said.

6.title:
🇳🇬🌍 “Very promising”: Nigerian #WYF2024 participant on BRICS and prospects it provides for the country and Africa

Nigeria's potential BRICS membership will help the country with debt settlement, GDP
6.content:
🇳🇬🌍 “Very promising”: Nigerian #WYF2024 participant on BRICS and prospects it provides for the country and Africa

Nigeria's potential BRICS membership will help the country with debt settlement, GDP growth and financial crisis, David Okpatuma, the board chair of the Development and Corporation for Africa Initiative told Sputnik Africa on the sidelines of the World Youth Festival.

“We would develop our own internal payment and debt settlement systems. […] It's also going to improve the inflow of trade and improve the GDP of the country. So basically, I see the membership of Nigeria to the BRICS Plus as a very promising intervention that will salvage the current financial crisis, especially being experienced in Nigeria and other African countries,” Okpatuma said.

Moreover, Nigeria could experience the benefits of the BRICS Bank and the BRICS Pay payment system. As a major trading partner to the global markets, the country could also contribute to and benefit from the trade within the bloc.

6.title:
🇳🇬"Stocks and barrels": Nigeria's Dangote reportedly aims to set up trading arm for his huge refinery

Africa's richest man, Aliko Dangote, plans to create a trading division, potentially based in
6.content:
🇳🇬"Stocks and barrels": Nigeria's Dangote reportedly aims to set up trading arm for his huge refinery

Africa's richest man, Aliko Dangote, plans to create a trading division, potentially based in London, for his Nigerian refinery, Western media reported on Tuesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

The decision would reportedly diminish the influence of the largest global trading companies, which have been in talks for months to provide the refinery with financing and crude oil in return for exporting goods.

Major energy companies — including Singaporean Trafigura, UK's BP and Swiss-Dutch Vitol — have recently met with Dangote in Lagos and London to provide loans for the approximately $3 billion in working capital the refinery needs to buy significant amounts of crude oil, trading sources told the media.

6.title:
🌍🇷🇺 "Multipolarity is new world order": Head of Ghana delegation hails World Youth Festival in Russia

The World Youth Festival being held in the Sirius Federal Territory shows that Russia embraces
6.content:
🌍🇷🇺 "Multipolarity is new world order": Head of Ghana delegation hails World Youth Festival in Russia

The World Youth Festival being held in the Sirius Federal Territory shows that Russia embraces different cultures and nationalities, revealing a new world order of multipolarity, Dr. John Aggrey, CEO of the Ghana Russia Center for Commerce and Relations and the head of the Ghanaian delegation in the #WYF2024, told Sputnik Africa.

He explained that multipolarity offers African nations the right to choose their business partners and the sovereignty to choose their development path.

"Russia has exceeded expectations looking at a different culture, at different nationalities and people. I would say that a new world order is what we need now. Multipolarity and multilateralism is the new world order and a must-see because everyone has a sovereignty to be what they want to be," Aggrey said.

6.title:
🇲🇿 Almost 100,000 people left homes in Mozambique due to militant attacks, NGO says

Over 99,313 people — 61,492 of them are children — have fled their homes between December 22 and March 3 as a
6.content:
🇲🇿 Almost 100,000 people left homes in Mozambique due to militant attacks, NGO says

Over 99,313 people — 61,492 of them are children — have fled their homes between December 22 and March 3 as a result of the recent uptick in violence in northern Mozambique, Save the Children, an international non-government organization based in London stated on Tuesday.

Save the Children said that the conflict in Cabo Delgado, currently in its seventh year, has had a severe impact on the local population.

The increase in attacks came after a relatively peaceful period, with attacks concentrated in some areas in the northern part of the province. Approximately 600,000 people returned to their home districts last year in an effort resume normal life, the organization reported.

6.title:
🇱🇷 Liberian president issues decree on recovery of stolen assets

Liberian President Joseph Boakai on Wednesday issued a decree to identify and recover stolen state assets and prosecute current and
6.content:
🇱🇷 Liberian president issues decree on recovery of stolen assets

Liberian President Joseph Boakai on Wednesday issued a decree to identify and recover stolen state assets and prosecute current and former officials involved in their theft, according to the president's website.

The decree established a task force to work on asset recovery that will have the legal authority and public funding to investigate and recover illegally acquired state assets and seek the extradition of suspects involved.

The president labeled official asset theft in Liberia as a severe threat and stressed the importance of repatriating these assets. Travel bans on suspects and extradition efforts for those abroad were also outlined.

6.title:
🇷🇺🇳🇬 "Alternative to Western system": Expert reflects on Nigerian FM's visit to Moscow

By drawing closer to Russia, African countries pave the way for BRICS and gain an alternative to the
6.content:
🇷🇺🇳🇬 "Alternative to Western system": Expert reflects on Nigerian FM's visit to Moscow

By drawing closer to Russia, African countries pave the way for BRICS and gain an alternative to the Western-inspired system that has not benefited Africa, Prof. Lere Amusan, Professor of International Relations of Bowen University in Nigeria, told Sputnik Africa, commenting on the visit of Nigeria's Foreign Minister Yusuf Tuggar to Russia.

"The rationale behind African countries moving towards Russia is perhaps to have a way of joining BRICS, which is a prototype of South-South cooperation that the majority of developing states have been calling for," he said.

The expert also revealed the difference between Russia's approach to developing countries and that of the West - Moscow is ready to help transfer technology to developing countries, while the approach of West is based on "perpetuating underdevelopment."

7.content:

The Zimbabwean authorities have criticized the "gratuitous slander" and "defamatory remarks" of the US' officials and Washington's "illegal sanction" against Zimbabwe.

They also expressed solidarity with all nations affected by US sanctions in a similar way, the Zimbabwean Ministry of Information, Publicity and Broadcasting Services has said in a release.

"As a government leading a country with pretensions to global leadership, the Biden Administration must lead by example in showing the rest of the world how to act in accord with international law, rather than acting arbitrarily, both at bilateral and global levels," the release said.

France's military presence in Senegal will be reduced to about 260 soldiers from some 500 troops, with mostly
7.content:
🇫🇷 🇸🇳France to reduce its military contingent in Senegal by end of June, reports say

France's military presence in Senegal will be reduced to about 260 soldiers from some 500 troops, with mostly instructors remaining in the country to continue training, the report said on Wednesday.

In February 2023, French President Emmanuel Macron said he planned to "significantly reduce" the French military contingent on the African continent.

The French media reported that the number of troops at French bases in West Africa would be reduced by "a few hundred soldiers," while the Djibouti base would not be affected.

7.content:

Pretoria said in an urgent request that it was "compelled to return to the Court in light of the new facts and changes in the situation in Gaza — particularly the situation of widespread starvation."

⚖️ It asked the court to indicate additional provisional measures in the case concerning the application of the Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide in Gaza, citing urgent need "to ensure the safety and security of 2.3 million Palestinians in Gaza, including over a million children." 

It called on the court to do so without holding a hearing given the "extreme urgency of the situation."

7.content:
🇸🇳Presidential election in Senegal reportedly scheduled to take place on March 24

Senegalese President Macky Sall has rescheduled the presidential election to March 24, the media reported, citing a statement of the Senegalese government.

Earlier on Wednesday, Senegalese broadcaster RTS reported that Sall dissolved the country's government and appointed Interior Minister Sidiki Kaba as the new prime minister.

The French media reported on Wednesday, citing a court document, that Senegal's Constitutional Council ruled that the presidential election in Senegal must be held before April 2 — the day Sall's mandate ends.

"Today, the BRICS is a powerful, serious association, a magnet that attracts many countries of the
7.content:
🇷🇺 Putin calls BRICS powerful association that attracts many countries 

"Today, the BRICS is a powerful, serious association, a magnet that attracts many countries of the world. Indeed, these countries are gaining momentum today. Now the global GDP of the BRICS countries is larger than the GDP of the G7. And it will further increase," Russian President Vladimir Putin said.

The president's remarks came during his address to the participants of the World Youth Festival, which took place in the Russian federal territory of Sirius on March 1-7 and attracted 20,000 Russian and foreign young leaders.

Russia has assumed the chairmanship of the BRICS group of countries in 2024. The theme of the chairmanship is "Strengthening Multilateralism for Equitable Global Development and Security."

7.title:

"Transport, Urban Mobility and Road Safety Minister [Anuuyirtole Roland Somda] has expressed regret
7.content:
🇧🇫 Plane crash in Burkina Faso leaves five people dead, two injured, transport ministry states

"Transport, Urban Mobility and Road Safety Minister [Anuuyirtole Roland Somda] has expressed regret over the crash of an aircraft of private air carrier Lead'Air on Wednesday, March 6, 2024, at about 12:45 pm," the ministry said in a communique on social media.

The aircraft was en route from Diapaga Airport to the town of Fada N'gourma in eastern Burkina Faso and was carrying seven people, including two crew members. The crash occurred during the takeoff from Diapaga Airport. 

An investigation into the circumstances of the crash is underway, the ministry said.

Among other things, Vladimir Putin spoke about Washington's policy, noting that the monopoly of the United States is disliked by the vast majority of countries, including US allies.

"This [SPFS] is a very interesting
7.content:

"This [SPFS] is a very interesting system. It is something that is welcome. You know, the more the merrier, as they say. It doesn't mean that SWIFT is not a good system, but if there are other alternatives, Nigeria would consider [them] ... It's something that we will look at. And if it's in our interest to engage in it, we will for sure," the Nigerian foreign minister told Sputnik in an interview.

In 2014, after the first wave of Russia sanctions, several countries launched work on developing their own payment systems. 

The Bank of Russia has created the SPFS system, which ensures uninterrupted transmission of financial messages within and outside the country, while China has launched the Cross-Border Interbank Payment System.

The Constitutional Council of Senegal confirmed Thursday that the presidential election in the West African nation will be
7.content:
🇸🇳Senegal Constitutional Council sets presidential election for March 24

The Constitutional Council of Senegal confirmed Thursday that the presidential election in the West African nation will be held on March 24, as stated in a recent announcement.

The country has been embroiled in uncertainty about when the vote will take place since early February. Tensions arose when the government's failed attempt to delay the originally scheduled February 25 poll sparked widespread unrest and raised concerns over possible democratic regression.

On Wednesday, President Macky Sall informed the government that the election would proceed on March 24. Following the council's ratification of this date, the 19 candidates vying for the presidency are now able to start their campaigning 
efforts.

7.content:
What is the nature of the conflict?

▪️On Wednesday, the head of Moldova's Gagauz autonomous region, Eugenia Gutsul met with the Russian leader Vladimir Putin on the sidelines of the World Youth Forum.

▪️On Thursday, the head of the Moldovan government's press service, Daniel Voda, commented on the meeting, saying that the Moldovan opposition's communication with the Russian leadership contradicts the interests of Moldovan citizens.

▪️Acting Moldovan Prosecutor General Ion Munteanu reported that the materials of the criminal case against Gutsul would soon be submitted to the court.

▪️Also on Thursday, the Moldovan authorities raided members of the "CHANCE" party, which is linked to opposition figure Ilan Shor. Masked people searched and arrested them. They treated the people very harshly: they woke them up, intimidated them.

Gagauzia, an autonomy in southern Moldova, has traditionally favored rapprochement with Russia, while Kishinev has proclaimed a course toward European integration.

7.title:
🇸🇩🇺🇳 UN World Food Programme (WFP) warns that the conflict in Sudan could lead to the worst hunger in the world

The ongoing nearly year-long conflict between Sudan's military and the Rapid Support
7.content:
🇸🇩🇺🇳 UN World Food Programme (WFP) warns that the conflict in Sudan could lead to the worst hunger in the world

The ongoing nearly year-long conflict between Sudan's military and the Rapid Support Forces has also severely disrupted the lives of millions of people in the country.

“The war in Sudan risks triggering the world’s largest hunger crisis,” warned WFP Executive Director Cindy McCain. “20 years ago, Darfur was the world’s largest hunger crisis and the world rallied to respond. But today, the people of Sudan have been forgotten. Millions of lives and the peace and stability of an entire region are at stake.”

More than 25 million people in Sudan, South Sudan, and Chad are trapped in a cycle of worsening food insecurity, and the WFP is facing obstacles in delivering adequate emergency food aid to vulnerable areas in Sudan due to the ongoing violence and intervention from the conflicting parties.

Another UN body — the Security Council — is reportedly considering demanding an immediate halt to hostilities in anticipation of the start of Ramadan, the Muslim holy month of fasting, which begins on Sunday.

7.title:
🇺🇬🌍⚖️ “Did it African way”: Ugandan president praises chief justices for traditional conflict resolution

Yoweri Museveni argued that the African way of resolving disputes, which involves mediation
7.content:
🇺🇬🌍⚖️ “Did it African way”: Ugandan president praises chief justices for traditional conflict resolution

Yoweri Museveni argued that the African way of resolving disputes, which involves mediation and reconciliation, promotes truth-telling, unlike the existing formal legal system, that can suppress the truth by hiring a lawyer who is paid to "obscure the truth," the local media reported.

“I am happy that our judiciaries are realigning themselves with their African roots. The pre-colonial methods of handling disputes must be studied, and they have some positive elements in them that the present legal system must emulate. One of the core principles of African jurisprudence was truth finding, this differs from the current legal system, which we inherited from the British,” Museveni was quoted as saying.

Uganda's Chief Justice Alfonse Owiny-Dollo echoed the president, urging his fellow judges to promote the adoption of the African approach to resolving conflicts, emphasizing its efficiency and cost-effectiveness, the report said.

8.content:

"I call on all parties in Sudan to honor the values of Ramadan by honoring a Ramadan cessation of hostilities. This cessation of hostilities must lead to a definitive silencing of the guns across the country, and set out a firm path towards lasting peace for the Sudanese people," UN Secretary-General Antonio  Guterres said during a UN Security Council briefing on Sudan.

The UN Secretary-General also said that the values of Ramadan must prevail. Guterres referred to the Islamic principle of empathy and generosity and the need to "share and care," particularly with the poor and needy, during the month of Ramadan.

8.title:
🇮🇱🇵🇸 Israel rejects accusations of using hunger as weapon in Gaza, mission to UN says

Israel does not limit the volume of aid that is being transported to Gaza and is "working around the clock"
8.content:
🇮🇱🇵🇸 Israel rejects accusations of using hunger as weapon in Gaza, mission to UN says

Israel does not limit the volume of aid that is being transported to Gaza and is "working around the clock" together with humanitarian organizations and the international community to increase the flow of aid and distribute it more efficiently inside Gaza, a legal adviser at the Israeli mission to the UN, Yeela Cytrin, said. 

In addition, Israel, together with its partners, such as Jordan, Egypt, France, the US and the United Arab Emirates, is facilitating airdrops into Gaza, with over 550 packages carrying humanitarian aid airdropped over the past week and more to follow in the coming days, the Israeli representative said. 

It is also working with the partners to "repair and open bakeries in Gaza, which are currently providing over 2.5 million breads a day for the local population," she added.

8.title:
🇭🇹 Haiti prolongs state of emergency in the capital region until April after a spike in violence

"The state of security emergency is being declared in the entirety of Ouest Department for the period
8.content:
🇭🇹 Haiti prolongs state of emergency in the capital region until April after a spike in violence

"The state of security emergency is being declared in the entirety of Ouest Department for the period of one (1) month from Thursday, March 7, to Wednesday, April 3, 2024," the declaration in Haiti’s official journal Le Moniteur read.

The Caribbean nation's interim government also said that the nighttime curfew that took effect over the weekend would stay in effect through March 11, from 6 pm to 5 am (23:00 to 10:00 GMT).

The measures aim to restore order and help the government "regain control of the situation" in the region where armed gangs have repeatedly attacked police stations, airports and hospitals.

The leader of the "Les Patriotes" party, Florian Philippot, said that Macron has to be stopped or “we're all going to war.”

French political scientist Nicola Mirkovic argued that the potential troops deployment is “a red line that Russia will not be able to accept.”

Earlier, Israel said that it would increase the number of housing units in the occupied
8.content:
🇺🇳🇮🇱 UN condemns Israel announcement about advancing settlements in the West Bank, special coordinator states

Earlier, Israel said that it would increase the number of housing units in the occupied West Bank by 3,400.

"I condemn yesterday’s reported advancement by the Israeli authorities of plans for over 3,400 housing units in settlements in the occupied West Bank," UN Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process Tor Wennesland stated.

The settlements are illegal under international law and are escalating the conflict in the occupied West Bank, he added.

Aside from that, UN spokesperson Stephane Dujarric said on Thursday that any distribution of humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip is good, but more large scale deliveries by land are needed.

In the Russian city of Sochi, near the World Youth Festival's location, International Women's Day is truly celebrated in a big
8.content:
🇷🇺🍰🫐 Russian confectioners made the largest berry cake in the world

In the Russian city of Sochi, near the World Youth Festival's location, International Women's Day is truly celebrated in a big way.

The dessert is striking in its size: its length is four meters and its width is almost 2.5 meters. The height is 13 cm.

The production of the delicacy weighing 623 kg required 20 confectioners to work for three days in a row and use 120 kg of berries. The cost of such a dessert is about 1 million rubles (approx. $11,000).

According to the editor-in-chief of the Russian register of records, this sweet treat is the largest in Russia and the world in the berry cakes category.

8.content:
🇿🇦 SA President Ramaphosa warns Zuma-backed party against violence

President Cyril Ramaphosa said that members of the Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party, backed by his predecessor Jacob Zuma, who are threatening to riot if they are not allowed to contest the elections in late May, will be arrested.

"I just want to make it clear to anyone who is threatening any form of unrest, there will be follow up and they will be arrested," Cyril Ramaphosa said. "Those are people who belong in jail, they are the people who are the enemies of our democracy."

On Wednesday, MK official Visvin Reddy warned that failure to allow the party's candidates to contest the election would end in "civil war."

Later, in an interview with a local publication, Reddy said that his words had been taken out of context and that the video of his remarks had been edited.

"I would say Russia's narrative drowned out the US governments in the past years
8.content:
🇺🇸🌍 US losing information war in Africa to Russia, AFRICOM general says

"I would say Russia's narrative drowned out the US governments in the past years [...] They were excelling," Gen. Michael E. Langley, commander of the US military's Africa Command (AFRICOM), said in congressional testimony.

The United States needs to not only continue building up its military and security capacity but also double down in efforts to tell the "story of success" of the US Agency for International Development in Africa to push back on the Russian narrative, the commander added.

Langley also advocated more slots for African military partners in US military training programs, saying that this is also competition with Moscow.

"They’re beating us 12-to-1," he pointed out.

8.title:
🇳🇦🇩🇪 Namibian communities reportedly seek restoration of land in a dispute over legacy of German atrocities

Communities in Namibia who have been denied their property for over a century, and whose
8.content:
🇳🇦🇩🇪 Namibian communities reportedly seek restoration of land in a dispute over legacy of German atrocities

Communities in Namibia who have been denied their property for over a century, and whose forebears were slaughtered by German colonial forces, are demanding that Berlin hold new negotiations to administer the restitution of ancestral lands, the Western media reported.

Mutjinde Katjiua, the head of a faction of the Ovaherero Traditional Authority, reportedly said that the decision to exclude descendants of the affected communities from the negotiations contradicted a 2006 legislative decision, which stipulated that negotiations should involve the aforementioned groups and the government responsible for the atrocities.

"What we have now is a bilateral agreement to fund development aid. It's not even reparations and something to do with genocide," Katjiua told the media. "Germany must come to the table, discuss with us, negotiate with Hereros and Namas, and together we agree on what is appropriate to repair the damage [caused]."

The land is the only thing the communities can get if things don't work out, he reportedly added.

8.title:
🇺🇬 Uganda reportedly bans meat sales in Kampala to curb spread of foot-and-mouth disease

"Movement of cattle, goats, sheep, pigs and their products and by-products from, to, through and within
8.content:
🇺🇬 Uganda reportedly bans meat sales in Kampala to curb spread of foot-and-mouth disease

"Movement of cattle, goats, sheep, pigs and their products and by-products from, to, through and within Kampala Capital City Authority, Kampala District, is prohibited until further notice," Ugandan Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Industries and Fisheries said in a letter, as quoted by media.

Authorities have also ordered the closure of livestock markets, abattoirs, loading docks and animal shows in the capital.

As the local media noted, Kampala is a major market for livestock products in Uganda and home to the country's five largest abattoirs.

Foot-and-mouth disease is a highly contagious viral disease that causes blisters on the legs and mouth of an animal and can be transmitted to humans through direct or indirect physical contact.

8.content:

8.title:
🇿🇲⚡️ Zambia will implement load shedding as country faces severe drought

"ZESCO [state-owned power utility] announces the implementation of planned load shedding measures effective Monday, 11th
8.content:
🇿🇲⚡️ Zambia will implement load shedding as country faces severe drought

"ZESCO [state-owned power utility] announces the implementation of planned load shedding measures effective Monday, 11th March 2024, as one of the mitigation measures to address the Power Deficit. This decision comes after careful consideration of the current national energy situation which shows a serious power deficit caused by low water levels in the main storage reservoirs on the Zambezi and Kafue River Basins," the stated.

There will be daily load shedding lasting for eight hours starting from the beginning of next week, according to Victor Mapani, the managing director of ZESCO, who attributed the decision to the reduced water levels at Kariba Dam, the primary source of hydroelectric power in Zambia.

Last week, Zambia's President Hakainde Hichilema declared a national disaster and emergency in response to the severe drought. The country’s energy and agricultural security have been significantly affected by the lack of rainfall.

"The President of the African Union Commission,
8.content:
🇸🇳 The African Union welcomes a peaceful solution to the crisis in Senegal and will send observers to March elections

"The President of the African Union Commission, H.E. Moussa Faki Mahamat welcomes the peaceful resolution of the institutional crisis in Senegal. He welcomes the decision of President Macky Sall to organize the elections on March 24, 2024, before the end of his mandate on April 2, 2024," AU’s statement read.

The chairman also said that the "wise" decision reflected the "roots and resilience of Senegal's democracy, of which Africa has always been proud."

Furthermore, Faki called on all political forces and civil society to initiate a transparent, peaceful and legitimate electoral process, adding that the AU will send its observer mission to the elections.

9.title:
🪐 Neptune-like exoplanet with a boiling ocean discovered by scientists, reports say

The assumption that the exoplanet is covered with a boiling hot "ocean" is based on the fact that water vapor,
9.content:
🪐 Neptune-like exoplanet with a boiling ocean discovered by scientists, reports say

The assumption that the exoplanet is covered with a boiling hot "ocean" is based on the fact that water vapor, methane, and carbon dioxide were detected in its atmosphere.

The exoplanet, which was discovered with NASA's James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), is located approximately 70 light years away. Its mass is slightly exceeding that of 4.5 Earths, and it has an atmosphere with pressures tens or hundreds of times greater than that of Earth's surface.

One side of the exoplanet is constantly facing its red dwarf star while the opposite side remains in perpetual darkness, which results in a significant temperature contrast. 

"The ocean would be extremely hot on the day side. The night side could potentially host habitable conditions," Professor of Astrophysics and Exoplanetary Science Nikku Madhusudhan of the Institute of Astronomy at the University of Cambridge, who led the analysis, noted.

9.title:
🇧🇫 💸 Burkina Faso receives nearly 30 billion FCFA (about $50 million) to produce fertilizers and process cotton

These loans were granted by the West African Development Bank (WADB), the Burkina
9.content:
🇧🇫 💸 Burkina Faso receives nearly 30 billion FCFA (about $50 million) to produce fertilizers and process cotton

These loans were granted by the West African Development Bank (WADB), the Burkina Information Agency (AIB) reports.

🔺 The first loan, of 15 billion FCFA (around $25 million), is intended to finance a project to purchase and process 427,500 tons of seed cotton into fiber cotton; 

🔺The second credit amounts to 14 billion FCFA (about $23 million). It aims to strengthen the logistical capacities of the Burkina phosphate exploitation company (SEPB). The latter will thus be able to purchase the raw materials necessary for the production of mineral fertilizer accessible to small producers in the country;

🔺Finally, a separate loan of 30 billion FCFA (about $50 million) granted by the WADB will finance the modernization of Burkina Faso's national road RN4 (Ouaga-Fada axis), including the track serving the country's Thomas Sankara University, the AIB noted.

9.title:
🇨🇮 🛢 Major oil field discovered in the waters of the Gulf of Guinea offshore Cote d'Ivoire

The field's reserves are estimated at
9.content:
🇨🇮 🛢 Major oil field discovered in the waters of the Gulf of Guinea offshore Cote d'Ivoire

The field's reserves are estimated at 1.5-2 billion barrels of oil and up to 2.4 trillion cubic feet (about 67 billion cubic meters) of natural gas, according to the Ecofin business news agency.

The oil was discovered in a 7 km deep well. The exploration was carried out by the Italian energy company Eni together with the Ivorian company Petroci.

In 2021, these companies discovered the first major oil and gas field, Baleine, off the coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Its first phase came on stream last year and is now producing 22,000 barrels of oil per day. 

Baleine's reserves are estimated at 2.5 billion barrels of oil and 3.3 trillion cubic feet (about 93 billion cubic meters) of gas. It required an investment of $10 billion.

Experts estimate that by 2027, Ivory Coast will be one of the top ten oil producers in Africa.

9.title:
