The conversation between Special Representative of
9.content:
🇱🇾 Russia's deputy foreign minister discusses with a Libyan politician the situation in the country and the preparations for the elections in Libya

The conversation between Special Representative of the Russian President for the Middle East, Mikhail Bogdanov, and the head of the Ihya Libya movement, Aref Nayed, took place in Dubai (UAE), Russia's Foreign Ministry stated.

In June 2023, in the Moroccan city of Bouznika, the Libyan "6+6" joint committee, which included members of Libya's High Council of State (HCS) and the country's parliament, agreed on presidential and legislative electoral laws. It was decided that the elections should be held within 240 days from the date of publication of the legislative framework.

After the fall of Muammar al-Qaddafi's regime, Libya descended into a political crisis and currently has two governments. One is the eastern cabinet formed by the parliament, and the other is the national unity government led by Abdelhamid Dbeibah and based in Tripoli.

9.title:
🇪🇬 Missing upper part of Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses II statue discovered after 94 years

The discovery was made by an Egyptian-US archaeological team, complementing the lower half which was unearthed in
9.content:
🇪🇬 Missing upper part of Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses II statue discovered after 94 years

The discovery was made by an Egyptian-US archaeological team, complementing the lower half which was unearthed in the Ashmunein region of Al Minya province in 1930 by German archaeologist Gunther Roeder.

This newly discovered top segment, measuring 3.8 meters in height, features Ramses II's head, shoulders, and upper torso.

Moreover, the statue depicts the pharaoh adorned with the dual crown symbolizing his dominion over both Upper and Lower Egypt, with a cobra, a significant symbol of royalty in ancient Egyptian culture, prominently displayed at the front of the crown.

Ramses II, renowned as Ramses the Great, governed as the third pharaoh of the 19th Dynasty of Egypt from 1279 to 1213 BC. He is the pharaoh with the longest reign and one of the most frequently depicted figures in Ancient Egypt.

The move follows the lifting of sanctions imposed on Niger by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), the
9.content:
🇳🇬 🇳🇪 Nigeria begins logistical procedures to open border with Niger

The move follows the lifting of sanctions imposed on Niger by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), the Nigerian newspaper Vanguard reported on Saturday, citing an official source.

The ECOWAS sanctions against Niger have already been lifted, with the resumption of electricity supplies to the country as a first step, according to local officials.

According to the decision announced by ECOWAS, the sanctions imposed on Niger since the military takeover in July 2023 will be lifted. 

This means that Niger's borders and airspace will be reopened, financial transactions between ECOWAS countries and Niger will be allowed, and Niger's frozen financial assets will be returned.

In a March 6 decree, Sall set March 24 as the date for the presidential election. The next day, Senegal's Constitutional Council approved the date.

9.title:
🇸🇩 Sudanese army has four conditions to halt fighting with RSF during Ramadan, says foreign ministry

The ministry welcomed the appeal by UN Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres, who stressed the need
9.content:
🇸🇩 Sudanese army has four conditions to halt fighting with RSF during Ramadan, says foreign ministry

The ministry welcomed the appeal by UN Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres, who stressed the need for the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) to withdraw from the states of Gezira and Sennar and all the towns they attacked after signing a declaration of humanitarian principles in May 2023, and then to regroup their troops in an agreed location.

The conditions also include an end to the "atrocities and violations" of international humanitarian law committed by the RSF in various states across the country.

Finally, the Sudanese government demanded the return of public and private loot and the accountability of the perpetrators of the destruction of public facilities and civilian property.

On Friday, the UN Security Council adopted a resolution calling for a ceasefire in Sudan during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

9.content:
🇷🇼 Rwandan incumbent leader Paul Kagame selected by the country's ruling party as its candidate for the upcoming July election

Kagame faces competition only from opposition Green Party leader Frank Habineza, who is a member of parliament and received just 0.45% of the vote in the 2017 election.

Victoire Ingabire, the leader of the unregistered Dalfa Umurunzi movement and a potential challenger to Kagame, is currently ineligible to run for president due to a previous conviction. A decision on her eligibility to participate in the presidential race will be made on March 13.

10.title:
🇪🇺 🇺🇸 Europe must prepare for possible US withdrawal from NATO if Trump elected – reports

This warning comes after Trump expressed dissatisfaction with NATO's functioning and indicated a willingness
10.content:
🇪🇺 🇺🇸 Europe must prepare for possible US withdrawal from NATO if Trump elected – reports

This warning comes after Trump expressed dissatisfaction with NATO's functioning and indicated a willingness to withdraw the US from the alliance if EU partners do not increase their financial contributions to their own security, Western media reported.

EU diplomats are expressing concern and emphasizing the need for NATO member states to consider how to protect themselves in the event of a US withdrawal. 

"Nobody knows what he’s going to do next," one diplomat was quoted as saying.

Another diplomat from a NATO country said that Trump's words only further highlighted Europe's excessive dependence on the US, the report said.

A third diplomat noted that uncertainty over US membership in NATO would make European countries "think in our own capitals more about the defense planning – is it adequate or not," the newspaper reported.

content-segmented: 🇳🇪 Weapons depot at EUCAP Sahel headquarters: Niger has released the results of the investigation
The European Union Capacity Building Mission in Niger (EUCAP) was launched in Niger in 2012 for peacekeeping, fighting organized crime and preventing conflict.
In early December, the Nigerien authorities said they terminated an agreement with EU on the deployment of the mission.
🔹 The list of weapons regularly imported into Niger by EUCAP didn't include several weapons found in headquarters of the mission.
🔹 57 French-owned weapons were completely destroyed without authorization and are not included in any official list.
This is what investigators see as a cover-up of evidence;
🔹 Anti-tank missile launchers and explosives found were also imported into Niger without authorization;
🔹 16 new motorcycles, commonly used by armed terrorist groups, were found in the EUCAP Sahel fleet;
Niger's security services clearly place France at the center of "this subversive activity," media reported.

Although there are no political obstacles, there are procedural and administrative
10.content:
🇱🇾 🇷🇺 Libya ready to cooperate on opening of Russian Consulate General in Benghazi, says GNU Foreign Ministry

Although there are no political obstacles, there are procedural and administrative hurdles that need to be overcome, Taher al-Baour, the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Libya's Government of National Unity (GNU), told Sputnik.

Earlier, Russian Ambassador to Libya Aydar Aganin told Sputnik that the opening of the Russian Consulate General in Benghazi had been postponed and that the Russian embassy in Libya was working to convince the authorities in Tripoli of its importance.

The Russian embassy in Tripoli was fully reopened in August 2023, and the consulate general in Benghazi is expected to follow suit.

10.title:
Ukraine confiscates pensioner's apartment for supporting Russia

A pensioner from Vinnytsa in central Ukraine has had her apartment confiscated and been sentenced to four years in prison for
10.content:
Ukraine confiscates pensioner's apartment for supporting Russia

A pensioner from Vinnytsa in central Ukraine has had her apartment confiscated and been sentenced to four years in prison for separatism, Ukrainian media reported. 

Alla Stadnitskaya, 80, lost her apartment and all her property following a court ruling in the first separatism case in Ukraine's history.

The woman has been living with relatives in Russia since before the start of the special military operation, so the verdict was handed down in absentia. Stadnitskaya's case was investigated by the Security Service of Ukraine.

10.title:
🇨🇩 Two rare species, previously unseen in the wild for decades, discovered in the Itombwe Mountains of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), reports say

The yellow-crested helmet shrike,
10.content:
🇨🇩 Two rare species, previously unseen in the wild for decades, discovered in the Itombwe Mountains of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), reports say

The yellow-crested helmet shrike, Prionops alberti, was last seen nearly twenty years ago, while the red-bellied squeaker frog, Arthroleptis hematogaster, was last seen by scientists in the 1950s.

A team of scientists from the University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP), guided by scientists from the DRC Centre for Research in Natural Sciences (CRSN), made the discovery.

The scientists hope that the discovery of these rare species will shine a spotlight on this underrated region and its unique plant and animal life, getting "people on board with caring and wanting to protect that diversity."

*Photos by Matt Brady and Eli Greenbaum/ The University of Texas at El Paso

10.content:

President Julius Maada Bio, recently paid a state visit to China from February 27 to March 2 at the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping. 

In an interview with Chinese media, the head of state highlighted the strong diplomatic ties between the two nations, which span more than five decades.

He emphasized the vital role of Beijing's support for infrastructure in the West African country, including bridges, hospitals and roads.

"I must commend the leadership here for supporting some of those initiatives," the president said. "They have been of immense importance to us."

10.title:
🇬🇦 Gabon returns to Economic Community of Central African States

Following the military overthrow of Gabonese President Ali Bongo Ondimba in August 2023, the country was suspended from the Economic
10.content:
🇬🇦 Gabon returns to Economic Community of Central African States

Following the military overthrow of Gabonese President Ali Bongo Ondimba in August 2023, the country was suspended from the Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) and the African Union pending a "return to constitutional order".

However, on Saturday, March 9, the representatives of the 11 countries of the Community noted "significant progress" in this process, "marked by popular support and the establishment of a timetable for a 24-month transition".

ECCAS also announced the lifting of sanctions against the country.

The Gabonese government appointed by General Oligui Nguema, confirmed that an inclusive national dialogue will take place from April 2 to 30.

Participants are expected to draft a new constitution to be voted on in a referendum.

10.title:

This measure will preserve the sovereignty of the country and will apply to any country,
10.content:
🇿🇼 Zimbabwe reserves the right to expel foreign missions deemed illegal, presidential spokesman says

This measure will preserve the sovereignty of the country and will apply to any country, regardless of its weight, George Charamba said.

"The size of the country, the military might of that country, the economic might of that country, the diplomatic might of that country is absolutely inconsequential when it comes to the sovereignty of this country and the need to preserve it," he said.

This comes after Washington announced the forced expulsion of staff from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) from Zimbabwe. The Americans were reviewing the political environment ahead of the 2028 general elections, Charamba was quoted as saying by the Sunday Mail.

According to the newspaper, the US personnel met with journalists, NGOs, representatives of civil society and opposition, as well as foreign diplomats. All this was done in secret and without the knowledge of the authorities, who were not informed of their presence.

For the past eight months, final-year students have been producing "tomatoes, potatoes,
10.content:
🇧🇫 📹 Food self-sufficiency: Burkina Faso's Ibrahim Traoré visits a "strategic" agricultural project site

For the past eight months, final-year students have been producing "tomatoes, potatoes, wheat, and onions" on farms in Bagré, explains a young farmer. Before that, they learned how to deal with the rainy and dry seasons.

The president has promised to provide the students with the first sets of seeds, fertilizers and everything else they need.

"We also hope that you will soon become teachers," Traoré said. Passing on knowledge will "broaden the base of young agricultural entrepreneurs," he stressed.

"You will have to get other young people interested in the land, in production and processing," he continued, explaining that the development of agriculture will ensure the country's food self-sufficiency.

This initiative was launched by the authorities with the Ministry of Higher Education, Ibrahim Traoré noted.

10.title:
🇸🇩 🕊 Arab League secretary-general appeals for ceasefire in Sudan's 11-month conflict

Ahmed Aboul Gheit's call for peace amid the ongoing conflict between the military and the paramilitary Rapid
10.content:
🇸🇩 🕊 Arab League secretary-general appeals for ceasefire in Sudan's 11-month conflict

Ahmed Aboul Gheit's call for peace amid the ongoing conflict between the military and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces came during talks with Abdullah Hamdok, former prime minister and head of Sudan's Coordination of Civil Democratic Forces. 

The Arab League expressed its commitment to support the Sudanese parties in resolving the crisis and stressed the importance of stopping the war and preserving the country's territorial integrity. 

Earlier, the UN Security Council also urged an immediate cessation of hostilities in Sudan during the upcoming holy month of Ramadan and called for a sustainable solution to the fighting through dialogue. 

The conflict in the North African country has resulted in significant loss of life and displacement since April 2023, with previous ceasefire attempts failing to end the violence.

11.title:
🇫🇷 After the failure of its African policy, France is trying to create an image of a peacemaker in Nagorno-Karabakh, Russian Foreign Ministry says

Meanwhile, it's in fact Russia that has been
11.content:
🇫🇷 After the failure of its African policy, France is trying to create an image of a peacemaker in Nagorno-Karabakh, Russian Foreign Ministry says

Meanwhile, it's in fact Russia that has been playing a peacekeeping role in the region, Russian Foreign Ministry Spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said.

In late February, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan paid an official visit to France. At a joint briefing with him, French President Emmanuel Macron said that Paris supports efforts to establish a just and lasting peace in the South Caucasus.

The decades-long conflict over the Armenian-majority breakaway state of Nagorno-Karabakh, located in Azerbaijan, reignited in the fall of 2020, marking the worst escalation since the 1990s. Hostilities ended in a Russia-brokered ceasefire and the deployment of Russian peacekeepers to the region.

In September 2023, Azerbaijan launched what it called "local anti-terrorist activities" in Nagorno-Karabakh aimed at "restoring the constitutional order." At a meeting mediated by Russian peacekeepers the following day, Azerbaijan and representatives of the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh agreed on a complete cessation of hostilities.

11.title:
🇱🇾 Libya's key political forces agree to form unified government, hold elections, Arab League says

The agreement was reached during a meeting between the Secretary General of the League of Arab
11.content:
🇱🇾 Libya's key political forces agree to form unified government, hold elections, Arab League says

The agreement was reached during a meeting between the Secretary General of the League of Arab States (LAS), Ahmed Aboul Gheit, the Chairman of the Libyan Presidential Council, Mohamed al-Menfi, the Speaker of the Libyan House of Representatives, Aguila Saleh, and the Chairman of the Supreme Council of State, Mohamed Takala, on Sunday at the LAS headquarters in Cairo.

"The agreed-upon points include … Forming a unified government tasked with overseeing the electoral process and providing necessary services to citizens," the LAS said in a statement.

Those gathered also agreed to create a technical committee that would consider amendments to the bill on presidential and parliamentary elections for "resolving outstanding issues on controversial points in accordance with existing legislation," according to the statement.

11.title:
🇹🇩 🗳 Chad's interim prime minister announces candidacy for presidency in upcoming May elections

Prime Minister Succès Masra's announcement that he will run for president in the May 6 elections came
11.content:
🇹🇩 🗳 Chad's interim prime minister announces candidacy for presidency in upcoming May elections

Prime Minister Succès Masra's announcement that he will run for president in the May 6 elections came eight days after transitional President General Mahamat Idriss Déby Itno announced his candidacy.

"I am running for president to heal hearts and unite the people," Masra said at a rally on Sunday, addressing hundreds of activists from his Les Transformateurs party who urged him to run.

Masra, age 40, a former opposition figure, had signed a reconciliation agreement with Mr. Déby before he was appointed prime minister on January 1.

Responding to accusations that he had sided with the ruling military, he said reconciliation was a necessity for the good of the nation.

"It was an agreement of national reconciliation, an agreement of the brave, so that our search for justice will never turn into a search for revenge," he said.

11.content:

Volunteers play a crucial role in their operations. The EFB, heavily reliant on Egyptian citizen donations, produces up to 60,000 food boxes daily, aiming to balance local support with their aid to Gaza.

11.title:
🇪🇹 Ethiopia to launch stock exchange in third quarter of 2024

It will be a public-private partnership of 25% and 75% respectively, Brook Taye, director general of the Ethiopian Capital Markets
11.content:
🇪🇹 Ethiopia to launch stock exchange in third quarter of 2024

It will be a public-private partnership of 25% and 75% respectively, Brook Taye, director general of the Ethiopian Capital Markets Authority, told the media.

The first company to participate will be Ethiotelecom with a 10% stake. Five other public companies are being evaluated.

💬Under Taye's leadership, the authority is "creating the necessary environment to make it easy for companies to come to the capital markets," he stressed.

 Even though the country is lagging behind in this area, it could be beneficial because it will be able to draw on the experience of other jurisdictions, the official believes.

The stock exchange, the Ethiopia Securities Exchange, already exists as a legal entity. Its regulatory framework has been designed and experts have been hired, he noted.

11.title:

On Sunday, Shava informed the Southern African Development Community (SADC) about
11.content:
🇿🇼 🇺🇸 Zimbabwe’s Foreign Minister criticizes US “insincerity” regarding sanctions, calls for their complete removal

On Sunday, Shava informed the Southern African Development Community (SADC) about the US's purported sanctions removal but reiterated Zimbabwe's firm stance on the necessity of the complete lifting of the embargo.

“While this is a welcome development, it falls far, far short of what we expect and want. The fact that 11 Zimbabwean individuals have been placed on the so-called Global Magnitsky sanctions program certainly points to the insincerity of the US government on this matter,” Minister Frederick Shava said.

On March 4, the United States announced the lifting of some economic sanctions against Zimbabwe after President Joe Biden revoked an executive order authorizing Zimbabwe-specific sanctions. Meanwhile, Washington imposed new sanctions on 11 Zimbabwean officials, including the country's president.

11.title:
🇹🇿 Tourism to Tanzania's national parks exceeds projected figures

Despite infrastructural damage from prolonged rains, Tanzania's 22 national parks have remained stable over the past year, Mobhare
11.content:
🇹🇿 Tourism to Tanzania's national parks exceeds projected figures

Despite infrastructural damage from prolonged rains, Tanzania's 22 national parks have remained stable over the past year, Mobhare Matinyi, the chief government spokesperson, reported.

Between July 2023 and February 2024, the national parks received 1,451,176 visitors, with the Serengeti National Park being the primary attraction. The figure surpassed the Tanzania National Parks Authority's  tourist target for the season.

The Serengeti National Park, located in northern Tanzania and designated as a World Heritage Site, is famous for its annual migration of wildebeest and zebra.

11.title:
🇷🇺 Russian President Vladimir Putin signs a law allowing the use of digital financial assets in international settlements

▪️This means that digital financial assets, digital rights of use, and
11.content:
🇷🇺 Russian President Vladimir Putin signs a law allowing the use of digital financial assets in international settlements

▪️This means that digital financial assets, digital rights of use, and digital rights that include these two instruments can now be used as a means of payment for imports and exports.

▪️Currently, only Russian digital assets are permitted, while foreign assets remain prohibited.

▪️Foreign counterparties can use real assets such as grain and gold as collateral for digital assets, according to Anatoly Aksakov, head of the State Duma committee.

▪️ Angola, Nigeria, and South Africa on the African continent could be get involved in this new payment method, Yaroslav Kabakov, a Russian businessman, estimates.

Deputy Prime Minister Temesgen Tiruneh and other senior government officials inspected the advanced stage of construction of the Lemi National Cement Factory in the North Shewa Zone of the Amhara Regional State. The factory is nearing the completion of major civil and electromechanical works and is poised to start production soon to increase Ethiopia's cement production capacity.

Arega Kebede, the Chief of the Amhara Regional State, asserted that the expected operation of the factory, with a capacity to produce 10,000 tonnes of cement per day, will meet the country's demand for cement. The $2.2 billion project, located 150 km north of Addis Ababa, is a pivotal development for the nation's construction sector.

A detachment of the Russian Pacific Fleet, including the frigate Marshal Shaposhnikov, has docked at the
12.content:
🇷🇺 🇮🇷 🇨🇳 Russia, Iran, and China have commenced joint military drills in the Gulf of Oman

A detachment of the Russian Pacific Fleet, including the frigate Marshal Shaposhnikov, has docked at the Iranian port of Chabahar, escorted by the cruiser Varyag.

The maneuvers, known as Maritime Security Belt - 2024, are aimed at ensuring the security of maritime economic activities. The naval drills began on March 12 in the Gulf of Oman, located in the Arabian Sea.

▪️China has dispatched three ships, including a guided-missile destroyer, a guided-missile frigate and a supply ship.

▪️Iran is participating with over 10 ships, boats, supply ships, and three helicopters.

▪️South Africa will attend as an observer, while Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, and India will also be present.

12.title:
🇳🇪 Niger will hold its first Digital Week next April, the country's minister of communication, posts and digital economy announces

Sidi Mohamed Raliou revealed this during a press briefing in Niamey
12.content:
🇳🇪 Niger will hold its first Digital Week next April, the country's minister of communication, posts and digital economy announces

Sidi Mohamed Raliou revealed this during a press briefing in Niamey on Friday. The event is part of a national effort to promote the digital transformation of the country.

The minister also mentioned several major initiatives planned by the government, which reflect "the will of the Nigerien authorities at the highest level, to follow the progress of the world by making digital technology a lever for socio-economic development."

These include digitizing public administration, modernizing infrastructure and facilitating internet access, setting up a National Cybersecurity Center, as well as ensuring universal access to quality connectivity at an affordable cost.

The government announced in October 2023 that it launched a reform process that included, in particular, the adoption of a new digital development policy for 2023-2032, as well as the improvement of the legal and institutional framework of the sector.

12.title:
🌍 🇨🇳 Trade volume between China and African countries has already exceeded $47 billion this year, reports say

The trade volume grew by
12.content:
🌍 🇨🇳 Trade volume between China and African countries has already exceeded $47 billion this year, reports say

The trade volume grew by 13.9% in the first two months of this year. From January 1 to February 29, China's exports to Africa increased by 21% to reach $28.78 billion. China's imports from African countries increased by 4.5% to $18.89 billion.

China mainly sells manufactured goods to African countries, including textiles and clothing, machinery and electronics. Africa supplies China with raw materials: oil, copper, cobalt, iron ore.

The China-Africa Cooperation Vision 2035, released in 2021, outlines plans for China to support Africa in creating and establishing "Made in Africa" brands. Through collaboration, China aims to help Africa develop its manufacturing sector and connect to global industrial and supply chains.

South Africa is China's largest trading partner in Africa. It is followed by Nigeria, Angola and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

12.title:
🇸🇳 🗳 Senegal presidential race: Disqualified opposition candidate asks Supreme Court to reconsider election date

Karim Wade, son of ex-president Abdoulaye Wade, is seeking to invalidate the decision
12.content:
🇸🇳 🗳 Senegal presidential race: Disqualified opposition candidate asks Supreme Court to reconsider election date

Karim Wade, son of ex-president Abdoulaye Wade, is seeking to invalidate the decision to set the election date for March 24.

Wade, supported by members of his father's Senegalese Democratic Party, argued that the time between the recent announcement of the election date and the voting day is insufficient and violates electoral regulations. 

Karim Wade was disqualified from the election, initially scheduled for February 25, because he held French citizenship at the time of his candidacy, according to the Constitutional Council. 

Incumbent President President Macky Sall initially planned to postpone the election until December. The decision was met with protests and annulled by the Constitutional Court. Campaigning finally began last weekend.

12.title: 🌍 🇷🇺 Ambassadors of the BRICS countries have attended an event in Moscow called "Maslenitsa: Dialogue of Civilizations," dedicated to the traditional Slavic holiday of Maslenitsa which celebrates the
12.content:
🌍 🇷🇺 Ambassadors of the BRICS countries have attended an event in Moscow called "Maslenitsa: Dialogue of Civilizations," dedicated to the traditional Slavic holiday of Maslenitsa which celebrates the beginning of spring

Speaking at the event, Russian BRICS Sherpa and Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov praised the South African 2023 chairmanship of BRICS, calling it "outstanding."

"I am convinced that our commitment to traditional values is the key to moving forward with success, based on our wonderful understanding, a sense of friendship and warmth for each other, which is also associated with the onset of spring, and which is also associated with the Russian Maslenitsa," Ryabkov addressed guests of the event.

🥞 Maslenitsa is celebrated in Russia in the last week before the Great Lent. Common traditions include burning an effigy of Maslenitsa (symbolizing the end of winter), sleigh rides, folk festivals, and baking blini (a traditional Eastern European food similar to pancakes) during the holiday.

Take a look at Sputnik Africa's photos from the event and a video of a traditional Russian song performed at the event.

On March 12th, the world observes the World Day Against Cyber Censorship, a day dedicated to advocating for freedom of expression on the internet. This day holds particular significance in an era where information dissemination is predominantly influenced by mainstream media.

The biases embedded in Western news outlets have perpetuated distorted global perspectives, leading to "Afro-pessimism" in African reportage and biased representations of countries like China, Russia, and Iran, crafted through Western imperialist lenses, Dr. Is'haq Modibbo Kawu, former Director General of Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, told Sputnik Africa.

13.title: 🇪🇬 Egypt set to obtain initial
13.content:
🇪🇬 Egypt set to obtain initial $1.5 billion installment of extended IMF loan in the upcoming weeks, report says

Egypt will receive $1.5 billion as the first tranche of an $8 billion loan from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in the coming weeks, the Egyptian newspaper Al Mal reported on Tuesday, citing sources.

Last week, the IMF said it had agreed to more than double Egypt's loan program from $3 billion to $8 billion in light of the "significant macroeconomic challenges" the country is facing as the conflict in the Gaza Strip negatively affects its tourism industry and drives down revenues from the Suez Canal.

The $3 billion support package between Egypt and the IMF was struck in December 2022 and was to run over 46 months. So far, the country has received only $350 million, according to Egyptian media.

The US military killed three extremists from the Al-Shabaab terrorist group during an airstrike in Somalia, US Africa
13.content:
🇺🇸 🇸🇴 US military kills three al-Shabaab* terrorists in airstrike in Somalia

The US military killed three extremists from the Al-Shabaab terrorist group during an airstrike in Somalia, US Africa Command said on Tuesday.

"The initial post-strike assessment indicates that the US airstrike killed three al-Shabaab terrorists and that no civilians were harmed," the statement said.

The airstrike was conducted as a collective self-defense at the request of the federal government of Somalia and occurred on March 10 approximately 70 kilometers southwest of the nation’s capital, Mogadishu, according to the statement.

*Al-Shabaab is a terrorist organization outlawed in Russia and many other countries.

13.content:
🛥 The International naval drill 'Sea Security Belt-2024' enters active phase in the Gulf of Oman

The exercise involves over 20 ships, including support and warships from the Russian Navy, Iranian Navy, and PLA Navy. Its primary purpose is to practice safety in maritime economic activities.

The final phase of the exercise will occur on March 14 on the shores of the Iranian city of Chehbehar, where a debriefing will also take place. 

The Sea Security Belt-2024 International Naval Exercise is being held for the sixth time. This year, representatives from Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India, and South Africa will participate as observers for the first time.

However, Putin believes that ordinary people of Western countries support Russia in its struggle to help the nation of the Global South to gain "true sovereignty."

“But this is compounded by the fact that the desire to freeze the status quo, the unjust state of affairs in international affairs, is very strong in Western elites. 13.content:
🇷🇺 To Russia with love: Kevin Vladimirovich Johnson's view of Russian citizenship, ties with Africa

In early January, 44-year-old US-born boxer Kevin Johnson was granted Russian citizenship.

In an exclusive interview with Sputnik Africa, professional boxer and promoter Kevin Vladimirovich Johnson spoke about his journey to Russian citizenship, why Africa and Russia are getting closer and how he is helping the continent.

"I can tell you the truth, I feel honored. It's an honor. First of all, to be a citizen. Second of all, to be here. Third of all, to be able to vote. Like, 'are you hearing what I'm saying?', your opinion counts to this country," the boxer said.

Johnson also expressed his gratitude for the opportunity to get the Russian citizenship and highlighted his admiration for Putin, whom he described as sincere and genuine.

He told local media that the idea took flight shortly after he left high school in 2019, and revealed that he continues to work on getting the helicopter off the ground.

At least 61 people were kidnapped in an attack by gunmen on Buda, a community in northern Nigeria's Kaduna State, the
13.content:
🇳🇬 Nigerian gunmen reportedly kidnap at least 61 people in north of the country

At least 61 people were kidnapped in an attack by gunmen on Buda, a community in northern Nigeria's Kaduna State, the local media said, citing local residents.

One resident told the media that the kidnappers stormed the community en masse and fired indiscriminately as they abducted locals. The abductees included women, children and a nursing mother, another resident added.

A day earlier, media reported that militants from Nigeria's Boko Haram* terrorist group had kidnapped more than a hundred women in the northeastern state of Borno.

* Terrorist organizations banned in Russia and many other states.

13.content:
🇸🇩Sudan's army says it gained back control over national broadcast building

The Sudanese army had seized control of the state broadcast headquarters from the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), according to it's statement on X on Tuesday.

"[...] Today, [the armed forces] were able to seize the headquarters of the National Radio and Television Authority [...] from the desecration of the Al-Dagalo terrorist militia [i.e. RSF] and mercenaries from other countries. Your forces dedicate this great victory to the masses of our generous and patient Sudanese people," the post read.

📺 The broadcast building is located in Omdurman, a city situated on the opposite side of the River Nile from Khartoum. Omdurman is an integral component of Sudan's capital and has seen intense fighting near military bases, bridges, and supply routes.

13.content:
🇷🇺🌍 Russia-Africa relations have always been based on mutually beneficial cooperation, says Malian journalist

This is how Moussa Naby Diakité commented on Putin's remarks in an interview on Wednesday that Russia was not inciting African countries and not setting them against France, and that African leaders themselves wanted to cooperate with Moscow.

"Relations between Russia and Africa have always been based on mutually beneficial cooperation. Russia does not interfere in the foreign policy of African countries. It is sharing its experience with Mali," the journalist told Sputnik Africa.

However, France's actions in Africa have led to disasters such as in Libya, which has created a security crisis on the continent, and Paris has supported terrorist groups, including in Mali, he added.

"French policy has failed, so African countries are turning to Russia," the journalist concluded.

13.title:
🇺🇸🇷🇺 US trying to maintain channels of communication with Russia on arms control, US official says 

The United States needs to keep channels of communication with Russia on arms control and risk
13.content:
🇺🇸🇷🇺 US trying to maintain channels of communication with Russia on arms control, US official says 

The United States needs to keep channels of communication with Russia on arms control and risk reduction and is trying to do that, Principal Deputy Administrator of the National Nuclear Security Administration Frank Rose said on Wednesday.

"We are trying to talk to the Russians," Rose said during a discussion hosted by the Brookings Institution. "But quite frankly, every time we try to engage on these issues, we are rebuffed, and the central message we hear back from the Russians is this given the situation in Ukraine, everything else revolves around that. And that's very 
disturbing."

Rose added that during the Cold War and various conflicts, the US maintained a dialogue with the Soviet Union regarding arms control and risk reduction. He mentioned nuclear testing and emphasized that the US does not need to resume it due to the investments made in its nuclear stockpiles.

13.title:
🇹🇩 Food assistance for Sudanese refugees in Chad may end in few weeks, World Food Programme states

Unless more financing is secured, the provision of food assistance to Sudanese refugees in Chad,
13.content:
🇹🇩 Food assistance for Sudanese refugees in Chad may end in few weeks, World Food Programme states

Unless more financing is secured, the provision of food assistance to Sudanese refugees in Chad, many of whom are on the brink of hunger, will be halted in few weeks, the UN World Food Programme announced on Tuesday.

"The United Nations World Food Programme is today warning that life-saving programmes in Chad will grind to a halt in a matter of weeks without urgent funding," the statement read.

After the eruption of conflict in Sudan about a year ago, over 500,000 Sudanese refugees have sought asylum in Chad, crossing the vast desert border. As a result, Chad has become one of the primary refugee destinations in Africa, hosting a total of over 1 million people.

13.content:

"[Whether we deploy] is contingent on the ground situation, and the critical ground situation is that there has to be an authority that can be the basis for a police deployment, that enjoys constitutional authority in Haiti," Abraham Korir Sing'Oei, the principal secretary at the foreign ministry, was quoted as saying.

Kenya's President William Ruto said on Wednesday that under an agreed-upon procedure, Kenya will assume leadership of the United Nations Security Support Mission in Haiti to restore peace and security in the country as soon as the Presidential Council is established.

13.title:
🇬🇧💎 De Beers’ raw diamond sales hit $430 million in past six weeks

The value of rough gemstones sold by the UK-based company in the first sales cycle of this year, between December 21 and January
13.content:
🇬🇧💎 De Beers’ raw diamond sales hit $430 million in past six weeks

The value of rough gemstones sold by the UK-based company in the first sales cycle of this year, between December 21 and January 30, was $374 million, down from $497 million in the holiday season cycle that ended on December 20 of last year.

"I'm pleased to see a further increase in demand for De Beers rough diamonds during the second sales cycle of 2024," De Beers Group CEO Al Cook said in a press statement.

Cook attributed the decrease in the value of sales compared to the last sales cycle of 2023 to ongoing economic uncertainty in the US and sluggish sales in China, although revenues were buoyed by a rise in consumer demand for diamond jewelry in India. De Beers expects demand to continue to recover in 2024.

Cook attributed the decrease in the value of sales compared to the last sales cycle of 2023 to ongoing economic uncertainty in the US and sluggish sales in China, although revenues were buoyed by a rise in consumer demand for diamond jewelry in India.
De Beers expects demand to continue to recover in 2024.

14.content:
SpaceX's Starship is clear for launch Thursday after receiving federal launch license, US FAA says

SpaceX's Starship is cleared to conduct its third fully integrated test flight on Thursday after receiving the required federal launch license, the US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said in a statement to Sputnik.

"The FAA is authorizing the SpaceX Starship Super Heavy Orbital Flight Test 3 (OFT-3) launch," the FAA said on Wednesday. "The FAA determined SpaceX met all safety, environmental, policy and financial responsibility requirements."

The test flight is scheduled to take place between 8:00 am ET to 9:50 am ET on Thursday.

The US has conducted secret talks with Iran aimed at persuading Tehran to use its leverage over Yemen's Houthi movement to convince them to halt their attacks on vessels in the Red Sea, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

🌊 According to the report, the talks took place in Oman this January and also addressed concerns over Iran's nuclear program. Omani officials facilitated the talks by shuttling between the two sides so they did not have to engage directly, the report said.

The report said that the US was represented by the Middle East adviser Brett McGurk and Iran envoy Abram Paley, while Iran's delegation was led by deputy foreign minister and top nuclear negotiator, Ali Bagheri Kani.

14.title:
🌍 Global child deaths reach historic low in 2022, UN reports, noting progress in Africa

📉The number of children dying before reaching the age of five has reached a historic low, falling to
14.content:
🌍 Global child deaths reach historic low in 2022, UN reports, noting progress in Africa

📉The number of children dying before reaching the age of five has reached a historic low, falling to 4.9 million in 2022, the United Nations IGME said in a report on Wednesday.

The UN revealed that since 2000, the global under-five mortality rate (U5MR) has declined by more than half.

The report showed that some low- and middle-income countries have managed to reduce their U5MRs by more than average global 51% from 2000 to 2022. The UN cited African countries such as Malawi, Rwanda, Ethiopia, Uganda, Angola, Morocco, Senegal, Burundi and Tanzania as examples of countries where the rate fell by more than 75%.

Zimbabwean police issued a statement announcing the arrest of self-claimed pastor Ishmael Chokurongerwa of the Johanne Masowe
14.content:
🇿🇼Self-proclaimed pastor arrested in Zimbabwe for abusing minors

Zimbabwean police issued a statement announcing the arrest of self-claimed pastor Ishmael Chokurongerwa of the Johanne Masowe eChishanu (The Fifth of Africa) apostolic sect and several members of the church he leads for criminal activities, including the abuse of minors.

Police revealed that Chokurongerwa led a sect of more than 1,000 members on a farm northwest of the capital, Harare, where the children lived with other followers.

"Investigations conducted by police established that 246 out of 251 children below the age of 18 years found at the farm had no birth certificates and were being used to perform various physical activities for the benefit of the sect's leadership," the police said.

14.title:
Somalia receives 99% debt forgiveness from Paris Club Creditor Nations

"The Paris Club consensus and the expected additional bilateral efforts would result in a reduction of more than
14.content:
Somalia receives 99% debt forgiveness from Paris Club Creditor Nations

"The Paris Club consensus and the expected additional bilateral efforts would result in a reduction of more than $2.0 billion, representing 99% of the debt of the Federal Republic of Somalia owed to Paris Club members as of January 2023," the Paris Club said on Wednesday in a statement.

The consensus on the debt cancellation for Somalia was reached following its Completion Point under the Enhanced Heavily Indebted Poor Countries Initiative, which was approved by the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank in December 2023, the organization said.

The Paris Club welcomed Somalia's commitment to implement a comprehensive poverty reduction plan and an ambitious economic reform program. These efforts are aimed at laying the necessary groundwork for sustainable and inclusive economic growth.

14.title:
🇨🇮🇬🇭🍫 African cocoa plants reportedly exhaust their bean supply as the worldwide chocolate crisis is intensifying

Major cocoa facilities in Ghana and Cote d'Ivoire have stopped or reduced production
14.content:
🇨🇮🇬🇭🍫 African cocoa plants reportedly exhaust their bean supply as the worldwide chocolate crisis is intensifying

Major cocoa facilities in Ghana and Cote d'Ivoire have stopped or reduced production because they cannot afford to purchase beans, the Western media reported, citing four trade sources. As a result, global chocolate prices are expected to rise significantly.

Transcao, a state-owned bean processor in Cote d'Ivoire, has announced that it had stopped purchasing beans due to the high price, adding that it is so far continuing its operations by processing beans from its existing stock, according to the report. More major state-run facilities may be shortly shut down.

In Ghana, most of the country's eight cocoa processing plants have been forced to suspend work multiple times for several weeks at a time since the start of the cocoa season in October.

14.content:
🇬🇧🇷🇼 UK plans to offer rejected asylum seekers nearly $4,000 to resettle to Rwanda

The plan is said to be a variation of an existing scheme under which asylum seekers are offered financial assistance to leave the UK and return to their home country, the British media reported.

A feature of the new plan is that the refugees will now be offered relocation to Rwanda rather than a return to their country of origin, as the British Home Office reportedly believes the scheme may be of interest to citizens of war-torn countries.

In parallel, the UK is developing another project to send some asylum seekers arriving in the UK across the Channel to Rwanda for processing.

14.title:
🇨🇳🌍 IMF: number of Chinese workers in Africa falls 64% in six years due to funding decrease and debt

"At the end of 2021, the official number of Chinese workers in Africa stood at about 93,000, a
14.content:
🇨🇳🌍 IMF: number of Chinese workers in Africa falls 64% in six years due to funding decrease and debt

"At the end of 2021, the official number of Chinese workers in Africa stood at about 93,000, a 64% reduction from the 2015 peak," the IMF research showed.

This is due to the decrease in funding for infrastructure projects in Africa by Chinese banks and companies.
Another factor is the increase in public debt of a number of African countries, which does not allow their authorities the opportunity to conclude new agreements on large industrial projects.

The IMF further noted that in 2019, five African countries — Algeria, Angola, Zambia, Kenya, and Niger — hosted 52% of the total number of Chinese specialists working on the continent at that time. It is noteworthy that up to 25% of the total number of Chinese workers in Africa had their jobs in Algeria.

14.title:
🇳🇦📈 Namibia's population has grown to more than 3 million, representing annual growth rate of 3%

"The de facto population in Namibia on Census Reference Night was 3,022,401 and is made up of
14.content:
🇳🇦📈 Namibia's population has grown to more than 3 million, representing annual growth rate of 3%

"The de facto population in Namibia on Census Reference Night was 3,022,401 and is made up of 1,548,177 females and 1,474,224 males. Overall, females make up 51.2% of the population and males 48.8%, giving a national sex ratio of 95 males for every 100 females," a preliminary report from the 2023 Population and Housing Census read.

Since the previous census in 2011, there has been an increase in the number of inhabitants by 909,324 people. This represents an annual population growth rate of 3%, double the rate seen in the previous period from 2001 to 2011, which was 1.4%.

Statistician-General Alex Shimuafeni emphasized the importance of this growth trajectory and predicted that if it continues at this rate, Namibia's population could exceed 6 million by 2050.

The final results will be published by October.

Prominent Senegalese opposition politician Ousmane Sonko and Bassirou Diomaye Faye, a presidential candidate and secretary general of the African Patriots of Senegal for Work, Ethics and Fraternity party, have been released from prison in Dakar ten days before the country's presidential election, French media reported. 

Senegalese news portal Seneweb has reported earlier that Sonko may soon be released from prison as part of a planned amnesty initiated by Senegalese President Macky Sall.

In early June 2023, Sonko was sentenced to two years in prison for "corrupting youth." The court's decision sparked a wave of protests across the country. Later, an appeals court in the Senegalese capital, Dakar, ruled to overturn the removal of the detained Sonko from the electoral register.

"We will never take offensive actions, we will never take the initiative," President Emmanuel Macron told
15.content:
🇫🇷 France will never take initiative when it comes to hostilities in Ukraine, Macron says

"We will never take offensive actions, we will never take the initiative," President Emmanuel Macron told the France 2 broadcaster, when asked under what conditions French troops can be deployed in Ukraine.

The conflict in Ukraine is an "existential issue" for France and for Europe, and the current situation in the conflict zone is "difficult for Ukraine," Macron added.

Moreover, Macron added that the French defense industry is not ready for a high-intensity conflict, but France is ready to respond to a possible escalation by Russia and "make decisions to ensure that it does not win."

15.title:
🛥 At least 60 migrants believed dead in shipwreck in Mediterranean Sea, NGO says

"The survivors departed from Zawiya, Libya, 7 days before they were
15.content:
🛥 At least 60 migrants believed dead in shipwreck in Mediterranean Sea, NGO says

"The survivors departed from Zawiya, Libya, 7 days before they were rescued. Their engine broke after 3 days, leaving their boat lost adrift without water and food for days. Survivors report that at least 60 people perished on the way, including women and at least one child," the European maritime humanitarian organization SOS Mediterranee said on Thursday on X.

The rescue operation took place on Wednesday. The organization said it rescued 25 people "in very weak health condition" together with the Italian Coast Guard; two were unconscious and were airlifted for medical treatment to Sicily by helicopter.

Over the past year and a half, the Italian government has passed several bills to toughen the penalties for smuggling illegal migrants to the Apennines. The Italian Interior Ministry said that in 2023 more than 157,000 migrants arrived in the country by sea, up from 105,000 the year prior.

15.title:
🇷🇺🗳 "What an honor": Boxer Kevin Johnson on his first vote in the Russian presidential election

🥊 The Russian-American athlete, who was granted the Russian citizenship in January, told Sputnik
15.content:
🇷🇺🗳 "What an honor": Boxer Kevin Johnson on his first vote in the Russian presidential election

🥊 The Russian-American athlete, who was granted the Russian citizenship in January, told Sputnik Africa that the voting process was "pretty easy."

"The voting was pretty easy. You know, you get your paper, you give [them] your passport, you go into your booth, you fill out the ballot for who you want to select, and you drop it in the box," Johnson said.

Furthermore, the overall experience was also excellent.

"Everything, from the moment I touched down in Samara [a city where Johnson voted], everything was 15 stars. How can you go past seven stars? You got to come witness this. It's not just a normal day," he added.

Lastly, talking about the opportunity to vote electronically, Johnson reckoned that the virtual ballots can encourage young people to "get out and vote."

"It supports young people to get out and vote. If you take a young person's schedule between the hours of 9 to 5, that's their busiest time of the day but if they could just take 20 minutes out and do it virtually, not even 25 minutes out and do it virtually, that's everything," the boxer concluded.

15.title:
🌍🇷🇺 Cameroonian observer speaks about Russian presidential election

African observers who are inspecting polling stations across Russia will return home genuinely satisfied with what they have seen,
15.content:
🌍🇷🇺 Cameroonian observer speaks about Russian presidential election

African observers who are inspecting polling stations across Russia will return home genuinely satisfied with what they have seen, Serge Espoir Matomba, the first secretary of the Cameroonian United People for Social Renovation, told Sputnik Africa.

According to him, at a time when "the world wants to be multipolar, we have an obligation to know what's going on without waiting to be told what's going on. There is this growing misinformation that is being used today as a lever for manipulation." 

"That is why I am in Moscow today, to see with my own eyes how the elections are going, how the buzz around the elections is going, how the process itself is being set in motion," Matomba said.

"The image that Africa has often had of Russia in the past is changing exponentially," the politician concluded. "Africans are now realizing that Russia is not the country they were presented with. And that's a good thing."

15.content:

15.title: 🇳🇪🇺🇸 Niger's
15.content:
🇳🇪🇺🇸 Niger's Gen. Tiani ignores US delegation expected to meet with him in Niamey, reports say

The meeting between the head of Niger's ruling National Council for the Defense of the Homeland, General Abdourahamane Tiani, and the US delegation led by US Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs Molly Phee did not take place on Thursday, although it was scheduled, according to French media reports.

The US delegation was scheduled to visit Niger on March 12-13, but Phee decided to extend the stay by a day in hopes of meeting with the West African country's leadership, the publication said, citing diplomatic sources.

The US State Department said in a statement that the purpose of the officials' visit was to discuss with Niger's leaders "the return to a democratic path and the future of our security and development partnership."

15.title:
🇷🇺🇺🇳 International probes into Nord Stream attacks not transparent, Russian Deputy Envoy to UN says

The investigations conducted by Sweden, Denmark and Germany into the 2022 attacks on the Nord
15.content:
🇷🇺🇺🇳 International probes into Nord Stream attacks not transparent, Russian Deputy Envoy to UN says

The investigations conducted by Sweden, Denmark and Germany into the 2022 attacks on the Nord Stream pipelines were devoid of transparency, Russian Deputy Permanent Representative to the United Nations Dmitry Polyanskiy said on Thursday.

"There was absolutely no transparency for Russia. And they rejected absolutely any attempts to establish bilateral cooperation with Russia, though Russia is undoubtedly the affected state in this situation," Polaynskiy told journalists outside the UN Security Council.

Polyanskiy noted that any attempt by Russia to urge the UN Security Council to act was declined by the United States and its allies.

15.title:
🇿🇦🇮🇱🇵🇸South Africa prioritizes Palestinian lives over cutting ties with Israel, Minister Ntshaveni says

South Africa's Minister in the Presidency, Khumbudzo Ntshaveni, emphasized that the
15.content:
🇿🇦🇮🇱🇵🇸South Africa prioritizes Palestinian lives over cutting ties with Israel, Minister Ntshaveni says

South Africa's Minister in the Presidency, Khumbudzo Ntshaveni, emphasized that the government's top priority is to protect the lives of Palestinians, rather than immediately responding to parliament's request to sever diplomatic relations with Israel, as reported by local media on Friday.

Furthermore, during Thursday's post-Cabinet media briefing, Ntshaveni said that South Africa is "concerned" about continued hostilities and deaths in Gaza. 

She expressed hope that the country's application to the International Court of Justice will bring much-needed peace and humanitarian aid to the enclave. This once again underscores that only the two-state solution will bring about this change.

15.title:
🇷🇺🇪🇹 "Absolutely fair": Ethiopian observer impressed by Russian presidential elections

"Really, it is well planned, well
15.content:
🇷🇺🇪🇹 "Absolutely fair": Ethiopian observer impressed by Russian presidential elections

"Really, it is well planned, well organized. I have seen the voters, how they are electing. As to my observation up to now, it is absolutely fair. I appreciate it," Dr. Petros Woldegiorgis, an observer from Ethiopia and President of Bonga University, told Sputnik Africa.

He particularly noted the accessibility measures in place, including the option for citizens in distant locations to vote via telephone—a novel experience for him.

"The general feeling I have is wonderful," the observer remarked. "From Alpha to Omega, what I have seen now, honestly speaking, I'm very much excited."

15.title:
❗️Four people injured after Kiev regime's shelling of Belgorod, says governor

Four people were injured by the third Ukrainian shelling of Belgorod in one day, two of them in serious condition, the
15.content:
❗️Four people injured after Kiev regime's shelling of Belgorod, says governor

Four people were injured by the third Ukrainian shelling of Belgorod in one day, two of them in serious condition, the governor of the Belgorod region Vyacheslav Gladkov says.

Earlier, the Russian Defense Ministry said that air defense means destroyed five Ukrainian shells of the RM-70 Vampire multiple rocket launcher system in the sky over the Belgorod region at about 17:00 Moscow time. Gladkov noted that the air defense system was activated over Belgorod and the Belgorod region for the third time during the day.

He specified that according to the assessment of the doctors, the condition of two men is serious. The fourth victim had minor facial wounds and was not hospitalized.

“The voting process here is very
15.content:
🇷🇺🗳🇹🇿 “Very open and freely”: Tanzanian observer from the ruling party on the Russian presidential election

“The voting process here is very interesting. […] It takes very small time, just 3 to 5 minutes you are done, is very open and freely,” Joseph Mgaya told Sputnik Africa.

Furthermore, the observer pointed out that Russian citizens are voting “freely” and they can do it in every corner of the country – you just need to have an ID with you.

Mgaya also praised the “high-end” online voting technology that simplifies the whole election process.

“I'm very interested in it because it's high-end [and] […] it's very open,” he added.

15.title:
🇵🇸 Palestinian President Abbas tasks Mohammad Mustafa with forming new government, reports say

Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appointed Mohammad Mustafa as the new prime minister and instructed
15.content:
🇵🇸 Palestinian President Abbas tasks Mohammad Mustafa with forming new government, reports say

Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appointed Mohammad Mustafa as the new prime minister and instructed him to form a new government, Palestinian news agency WAFA reported on Thursday.

Abbas reportedly requested Mustafa to develop strategies for the reunification of administration in the occupied West Bank and Gaza, spearhead government, security services, and economic reforms, and combat corruption.

🏦 Mustafa has held high-ranking posts at the World Bank and formerly held the roles of deputy prime minister, economy minister and the chairman of the Palestine Investment Fund.

15.title:
🇰🇲🇷🇺 "The process is more than transparent": Comorian observer on presidential elections in Russia

The Russian presidential election has a number of advantages, including security cameras to ensure
15.content:
🇰🇲🇷🇺 "The process is more than transparent": Comorian observer on presidential elections in Russia

The Russian presidential election has a number of advantages, including security cameras to ensure transparency, candidate representatives at each polling station, "a more efficient electronic system combined with a reliable manual system," Ahmed Said Mdahoma, head of the Independent National Electoral Commission of the Comoros, told Sputnik Africa. 

He also noted "maximum" security to ensure the calm of the electoral process and "constant communication at the level of the Central Electoral Commission to inform citizens, observers and actors about the electoral process."

In addition, Mdahoma emphasized a 3-day voting period that would allow "everyone who wants to exercise their right to vote to find the right time" to do so.
